YQS2XjxlqI_iw2KyAznDLA.text: Average food.  The loaded cheese fries were not very loaded...many fries were just fries.  The fish tacos were ok but were a bit dry and could have used some more of a sauce.  The sweet potato fries were good because of the whipped butter they served them with.  I was disappointed with the beer selection.  With an ale house you would think they might have a better craft selection but it was very average.  Service was ok, the waitress was nice enough but seemed a bit flighty. Prices were ok, but the quality of food was not great so I would not make a special trip here.

IIIBSZi1fl4n_rjkz2zXXA.text: This is a very large location with plenty of tv screens to show the latest sporting event which was nice.  The family and I have been here twice so far and had fair experiences both times.  Service has been good; however, the food is not as good as I would expect a typical bar and grill would be.  I ordered the French Dip my first time and a Bistro Burger the second time.  The fries that come with the meal was nothing special and both sandwiches were on the bland side, again, nothing special.  I had a craft brew on my first occasion and that was enjoyable.  I think this would be a good place for friends to meet up to watch a sporting event and maybe order a couple of appetizers.  The food doesn't make me want to return with the family.

c6AXvV7_epnY1DZRdqDQng.text: The worst experience dealing with a hostess, we talk to the manager and he was worthless too.  I wanted to order a pitcher of  angry orchard beer and the waitress told me that I could not order it because they didn't offer that beer in a pitcher.  So I asked to speak to the manager again and I asked him why I could not order a pitcher of angry orchard?  He told me the alcohol content in that beer was too high and that they could not sell it as a pitcher, I told him that beer had the same level of alcohol content that Bud Light and all the other beers.   As I was speaking with him a birthday party was being conducted at the bar and there was about 12 young man highly drunk and making fools of themselves.   The food server the nice young lady with the wild finger nails  was outstanding!  Once again though the food was very good .  The server will be the only reason we probably will go back the manager was a fool and the hostess was very rude amazing how they stay in business.  Check out the drunks in the picture I post, I can't get a pitcher of beer but they can serve multiple shots to young people that are  totally wiped out.   Totally incredible!

photos.caption: Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. They won&#39;t sale a pitcher of angry orcher  beer because the alcohol content, but they will sale endless shots to this poor sap!

NNnqgplVnpD4b7_g1Sq3HQ.text: It has a great atmosphere, but food is lacking. The service was slow but they are still in training so I understand. I ordered a french dip sandwich that looked like it was served on a hot dog bun. It was hard to see it under all the onion rings it was buried under. The chips and spinach dip was good, but not enough dip to the amount of chips. They seem to pile on the sides and go light on the main dish.  This would be a good place to grab a beer and watch the game, but not to sit down and eat.

0_-9j-mdoreBTL3QZa0zFA.text: Processed, pre-cooked, pre-made food.  We went for Lunch on a Saturday.  There were 4 of us.  The Ale House Appetizer Plate:  everything was room temperature - nothing hot.  The potato skins were bland.  The Fried Cheese was okay, but again, not hot ~ it should be gooey and stretchy but it was like biting into a coated mozzarella stick right out of the refrigerator.  The chips & salsa was nothing special.  The artichoke dip was pretty good, and the onion rings weren't bad, but again, they weren't hot/warm.  The Cobb Salad with Grilled Chicken & Shrimp.  The lettuce was fresh.  The hard-boiled egg was rubbery.  The chicken & shrimp we both over-cooked and dry.  The English Style Fish & Chips:  It was okay, but again, probably would have been better if they were hot and freshly cooked.  2 people had the Build Your Own Burger:  Just gross.  The burgers were pre-cooked and seemed to be prepared like the whole 1970's boil-in-a bag meal.  The meat itself was pale.  The 'grill marks' were not  actually from the grill in the kitchen when it was being prepared for us ~ those grill marks were from the factory when it was packaged. I would rather go to In-N-Out.  And again - NOT HOT.  Not to mention items were left off of the orders.  The server himself was good.   The manager came by and asked us how everything was.  I told him what I thought.  He knocked 10% off the bill.  Although I appreciate that, we will not be back.

ll-AM-fJ5EZwtP_8UkRz5Q.text: I had lunch here, and ordered a grilled salmon sandwich.  The food had a smell so bad that i could not eat it.  I will not go back

hAGP0H1wLLJzju-H07CX3A.text: We love Millers Ale House.  They have been so good to Foothill Football and support our community. They have good food and good drinks and don't forget about the buried treasure dessert

iBNAcjQPe5IGKMSkrIrlNw.text: We keep getting disappointed by this place...love their salads, service is great, clean place...however....had jambalaya there ....horrible....had fish and chips there....greasy awful....2 days ago ordered a hamburger well done...still pink inside...what was worse...it had  no taste...blah. I know .... why do we go back...like I said love their salads and their beer selection. By the way, in all of the above unfortunate eating experiences when the waitress was told of the problems all we got was a  'oh so sorry'...no manager showed up...nothing. Won't be going back.

NsTfdUBkPgM09w231WWqUQ.text: Cortae and Rob are great and make it the best place to come to in Henderson!  Only place you should visit for football in Vegas!

DaPSDzmSFO5Ri5-FcHQuWQ.text: The people were great and the service very good considering they've only been open 2 weeks. Nice beer selection but disappointed that they have NO local beera, we've got excellent local brews they should make room on one of the many taps for local beer.  The food was ok, the seafood mac & cheese was very salty, kind of disappoimtimg.

EkDbnH0SXh6m3bxn-ysKVA.text: Always a fun time here. Food is great and you can never go wrong with television set up on every corner showing football! Love it.

_eXuVGZxbq7fxTrXaF8x-w.text: Love the fact it's like a new car smell here. Great staff, good food. I will be back. Had the lemon pepper wings and honey mustard. Had the right kind of coating. Love the loaded fries. Every one stop by.. drinks on me!

3eiOsHLFqt1R5cG5YRsiUQ.text: There are literally over 60 TVs in this place so wherever you sit youre going to be able to aee all four channels theyre playing. Sat down and it took longer than usual for our waitress to get to us. We ordered sodas and they were twice the size of a normal soda and we didnt need refills which was nice because our waitress never came to check on us. I ordered the ribeye and my friend ordered steak fajitas. Im not picky about fat on my steak (though 50% of the steak was fat) but what I am picky about is if there is a big fat VEIN in my steak. That is NOT normal. I stopped eating once I found it. I also ordered a caeser salad with it. I took one bite and pushed it to the side. It tasted old and the croutons had gross Italian seasining on them. My friends fajitas were good except when she ate the steak by itself, there was zero seasoning on the meat. The guacamole was just pureed avocado and was straight out of a container. Me and my friend had to convince each other to say something about the food because it was really that bad. The hostess came by and saw the look on our faces and told us shed go fetch our waitress. She came and said shed get the manager, Andre. He came and we explained everything. He was a little defensive about the food but overall he gave me a new cut of steak to go with more onion rings and he reduced our $50 dollar bill to a $20 bill. Overall our experience wasnt that great but I gave it 2 stars because of Andre. and how he did his best to fix everything. We wont be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. My fatty steak with the vein in it
Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. Gigantic soda!!

IGJrr0UjAgzU9jqq42rQKw.text: Honey bbq Zingers are very good, also "captain jacks buried treasure" was also very good. It's ice cream cake with heath bar and caramel and good stuff:) service was good, will definitely be back soon.

GOsVtftQkbdBEumHxacELA.text: Good for beers, sports and bar food. Really crowded. 40 min wait. Nice, clean and new though. Tv's everywhere. Friendly staff. The apps and food came quick. We ordered Cheese Fries and Spinach Dip as appetizers. They came quickly. The Fries were HUGE and delicious. The Spin dip was good too. Your average Spinach Dip, nothing special. My son ordered Spaghetti and Meatballs. It was terrible. There was maybe a tablespoon of cold sauce and three frozen meatballs. I don't recommend for anyone. Ever. Ha! But seriously, it was terrible, see my pics. The Husband tried out their 12 oz. Ribeye. It looked awful but he said it was ok, not great but what you'd expect for a $17 steak. I ordered the Catch of the Day, Blackened Mahi Mahi. It was ok. The fish itself was good, a bit fishy tasting but only a bit. I asked for blackened, I think it was broiled. It was still ok for $13. The baked potato was fantastic! Cooked to perfection and the slaw was good too. I might try the fish again in the Fish Tacos but probably won't order this dish again. We should have stuck to bar food. Steak and Seafood is not really their forte'. We'll try it again for sandwiches, burgers and apps. and see if its any better. The service was great. Fast and friendly.  All in all, it was ok, we'll give it another go.

photos.caption: Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. Catch of the day. Blackened Mahi. Just ok. The potato however was excellent!
Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. 12 oz Ribeye and Fries. Just ok. What you expect for a $17  Steak.
Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. Kids Spaghetti and Meatballs. As gross as it looks. Only a tiny bit of cold sauce, frozen meatballs, gross bread. Skip it!

-tLGzaFmCOqrKKvhgY22uQ.text: Amazing prices for the quality and quantity of food.  I love seafood and pasta and this place has a lot to choose from.  Seriously the prices can't be beat 14.99 for a pound of crab legs,  19.99 for twin lobster tails.... I have eaten here 2 times this week and I will be back next time I'm in town!

CLP8POQ-MHF9Q4BqD7u7uQ.text: What a waste. So many great TV's to watch games and Sports. Perfect location. Unfortunately the food really sucks. Everything is deep fried or crap. Worst bloody mary's ever. Beer is too expensive except for the PBR's lol. The service is just ok. Could be a real gem if they concentrated on better food and specials to bring in the locals.

Sy71YrYfLs6OIsXzbuU6tg.text: This new location is big, Service was great! Cheeseburger Flatbread was good, lots of draft beer to choose from. Lunch and dinner specials change daily.  Guacamole is not made in restaurant and tastes straight out of the box but good service, beer and food made up for it.

dogJ-2NhMzfXGoXYtD5ufg.text: Not bad experience good service, bad food, not all but u have to ask for steak be cook rare if u want it medium, no salt, simple and the mash potatoes I can taste the flavor from the box .........is a new place u guys can work in this little things

h9tN2dHGFIjNrbOshMje3g.text: Pros: My brother and I checked this place out today. The restaurant is pretty nice and clean. There are 2 bars where you can sit which was very convenient.  We ordered the zingers (chicken fingers) and were very tasty! We also had a spinach dip and calamari which were not bad.   Cons: Service was very slow and it wasn't even busy. Our bartender asked us what we wanted to drink and walked away (twice) to service other people. She did the same when we ordered the food.  The same bartender kept complaining to another employee how bad of a day she was having.  The tab was somewhat pricey for 4 beers and 3 appetizers.   I was really excited about trying this place out. However, not too sure I'm going back, though.

L7OIyMyLTKpWNYH3gIjsQg.text: Miller's is a great location to host many people in a party. We usually come here when we have parties of more than 8 people because the parking is easy, the food and drinks are reasonably priced, and the high top tables can accommodate the large party. Their happy house is 3-7PM and 10PM-Close, which tends to be great timing to meet up immediately after work or just for drinks after dinner. The only thing to really consider is if you are short on time because service tends to be on the slower side, even considering large party sizes. Last night at about 945PM, we had especially poor service with a waiter who was mocking some people in our party, asking "you are not a drinker are you?" I will probably still come back because we usually still end up have a great time here, but hopefully that waiter learns some manners and treats guests as if they were not high school students.

qpn8PMQ3jjzgnWV-enr04A.text: Summer was an awesome bartenders! Great service. Amazing Bloody Mary. Will come just for the service.

MgpdYfjdMIoayZgYK7xQtA.text: FOOD IS TYPICAL CHAIN REST.Had New England clam chowder 3 times on a Friday. EVERY SINGLE RESTAURANT I WORKED IN FOR 35YRS SERVED IT ON FRIDAY. When I have a seafood platter I like to start w chowder. So they actually lost a sale w 3 of us going to order it. MGR tried to say it's rotating. No way. Being from n.east that's what we like. Server was excellent. Prices are fine w many TV.s

qRZ3fZ4HS8XZD8mgP7Gpow.text: So the prices didn't sound bad and my friends wanted some drinks late in the evening so we decided to stop by. I saw a picture of the steak special. When we got there, the server let us know it's only a special on Thursday.  The prices sounded really reasonable but after waiting half an hour, they brought me the wrong order of my zingers, took it back and brought back the same wings with the sauce I did order on top of the wrong one I didn't. Like really guys?  I would definitely not recommend this place.

p1aOo1gIEfv5udfVkVrxZw.text: Beware all ye who enter. We waited over 45 minutes after placing order, only to receive 1 wrong meal, 2 overcooked lobster tails, and 1 order of chicken wings with the scarcest amount of sauce on them that they had almost zero flavor. And they were ordered "hot". After waiting so long for such disappointment, the manager advised us that it would be a 15-20 minute wait to remedy the wrong meal situation. At this point, dining with 2 kids who had done their best to behave during this ridiculous experience we were not going to add additional time. At least the manager removed the cost of the wrong meal. How nice. Especially since it wasn't what we ordered and no one ate it anyway (well, except for the red potatoes). What a disappointing experience for a first try. I don't think we will try it again. At least the kids meals of Mac n cheese and spaghetti were enjoyed by the kids.

vRxMudQFTTENDPAKXestPw.text: It's close, lots of TV playing sports and the food is always good.  My wife brought me here for Father's Day and I could not of thought of a better place to eat.  I went with my usual, the chicken nachos and the kids loved their food.  My son would live on zingers if i let him, and my daughter should have feathers at this point due to all the chicken strips she had eaten here.  The servers are always on point, and friendly and keep my glass full, which if you have read any of my past posts, is the most important issue to me.    My biggest is issue is I can't decide which way to sit to see as many TV screens as possible. We have never had to wait on a seat, as the restaurant is huge.  This is a family favorite and will remain so for a long time to come.

s1frWw4zlvPea6daGUGsQw.text: The service was great from the time the greeter to our server.  They have massive amounts of tv. The burger was great $10.29. I thought Farley priced for what you get. It was cooked perfect. Our server was super friendly and funny. His name is Brad.

7t3Aw0HsJehHoAov6FVtGw.text: We got the shrimp linguini and full rack of baby back ribs. The baby back ribs were luke warm. Very disappointing that it's our first visit and crappy food. Not even offered a replacement at least. Probably won't be back.

D7gAs-uNu2uHU3Q83B5L0A.text: The chef has zero clue about seasoning. Food has no flavor. I ordered a grilled salmon with potatoes and it was as plain as possible. I could not have been happier with their service and they made an exceptional impression on me. They were very polite and professional, and I never sat there with an empty beer.  I can't wait to come here again!

_fBnyIx5TRXMKQecimPf9Q.text: We ordered take out and picked our first and only order up.  I was shocked at the plain, cheap packaging and the food was not edible. We felt it went beyond the bad packaging. I ordered a chicken cesar salad, the chicken was the store bought type chicken fajita "meat", and the romaine was wilted beyond its time.  The Philly cheese steak was unrecognizable as a cheese steak. I wont return. I hate giving bad reviews.

vyvCtWOlZPVmAvCcC8csVQ.text: first time at henderson location and very impressed!!! our server NATHAN was excellent!!! he took our order by memory, repeated it back and he served the meal to the correct person without asking.Food excellent and fast. had the full rack ribs special yummy fall off the bone tasty, 35 fried shrimp good size freshly breaded and fried NOT frozen. zinger flatbed hot n fresh. we used to eat at the Town Square location and in the beginning they were EXCELLENT and after a year of opening it started to decline the food quality shrimps were smaller and frozen type, food not up to par. we stopped going about 8 months ago.!hopefully they TS location will improve. we live closer to henderson location so we WILL be back

pYGSqlwhWJWKIiL5exlAqw.text: Very pleased that we gave this place a whirl tonite! We were on our way to Outback when we saw the sign and said what the hell, let's try something new!     Everything was on point and the atmosphere was bright and clean. There was zero disappointment. The prices were great, the food was great, the service was great, I mean I don't remember the last time I had such good service and the place was pretty packed too! They offer a large drink menu and have a wide range of beers for all you booze hounds out there!     With the large number of flat screens and open floor plan with community tables in areas, this place would be ideal for meeting up with a large group of friends or for a work meeting or etc.......etc! All in all I was super stoked with the place and cannot wait to get back there to try more food! And if you haven't been there then get there!

nWlsmX85a3aIWr5nHC7B4A.text: I came here for the first time on a Friday night and will definitely be returning. The shrimp tacos are great. I wished it was quieter as there was yelling and loud televisions blasting, but that was to be expected since it was NBA Playoffs season. This is a nice spot if you want to watch a game, since there are large, flat screened TVs all around the restaurant. If you want to come here just to enjoy good food and good company, I recommend planning your visit around any big sports game.

Zzai1xM5If0_arlX-a1Suw.text: We have come here twice and both times it was delicious. The menu is large, the prices are fair, and the staff is always friendly. I wish the food quality was a bit higher but overall it's good for a family on a budget.

byU_IVAh-roOtni_Ol-POg.text: Bad service. Tonight was not the first time my food came out cold. A waiter and waitress couldn't figure out who was taking our table. Finally when they did the waiter came with this whole drawn out story about how he had come in late and she was taking his tables. Uh, don't care. Then I was refused the upgrade to a salad and charged full price despite removing a side from my meal. Potatoes were ice cold and the service was just flat out bad. This place is terrible and I don't know why, besides being fairly close to home, I keep coming here!

3lvCWXG-4OA_tToNw0ZhwQ.text: This place was such an awesome discovery! We were heading back to our hotel at Lake Las Vegas from the Strip and were craving drinks and dessert and I found Miller's on Yelp. They have awesome happy hour and drink specials.  My kids each got a dessert and they were huge! They really could have shared. My husband and I each got a pint of beer and they were $3 each. We will definitely be back on our next trip to Vegas. We want to try the food. It looked so good!

NUw2ogyk1RjNugOjKx9ZVA.text: Wednesday night special a Maine Whole Lobster. And no claw cracker to crack the claws with because of how popular the special was. Now what is a boy to do? So after the waitress apologies multiple times, the lobster is getting colder and colder. After a while the sorrys are getting old.  Then when the neighbors git their lobster with crackers, the waitress says sorry again!  Now it's is time for her to correct the problem., free dessert,  some off of bill, but nope, and you guessed it, Sorry again. Needless to say, not tip and no return!

photos.caption: Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. No claw cracker to be found

lDfaHPtzFk_Bu4Yy73AePg.text: Staff was friendly... I ordered the blackened Alaskan Salmon it came with maybe 8 small pieces of vegetable, it was quite sad and one of the baby carrots was all ugly looking... My daughter had the Ossobucco which was very mediocre to say the least and the presentation was pretty awful. My son is 7y/o ordered spaghetti and meatballs there was not enough sauce and the meatballs you can tell came from the frozen food section at grocery store. Will not be returning!

697R_t5hMsSuyg18W6Qt8A.text: The parking lot was so packed with cars we almost didn't stop in figuring there was a wait but when we entered the restaurant the place is huge and there was plenty of tables available so don't let this discourage anyone. Brandon was our server for lunch and he was an excellent server and super super nice! I had the french onion soup which was good and the zinger salad (mild  on the zinger sauce) the salad was good and the zingers were very tender! The salad consisted of lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, cheese, celery sticks  and the zingers. I also had a watermelon margarita and it was very good. It had watermelon flavored sugar around the rim YUM. Hubby had fish and chips and clam chowder and said both were good. He also had a pina colada which I tasted and it was delicious!  They have daily drinks, lunch and dinner specials that are very reasonably priced......for example Monday's dinner special is a rack of ribs with coleslaw and fries for $11.99! Good deal! Also lots and lots of different kinds of beers with specials too. Will definitely return.

ctQkyTMXZ_ifKszgMkWs6A.text: Had a surprise party for Husband, thank you sweet daughter. We has never been before and we had a blast. The food was great as was the service. We will be back.

L24IayDPJ-zhhlEWfsRv7Q.text: Good food, good times. Brittany was on point with the service tonight! Shes quick and her recommendation for the calamari was great! My steak was awesome ..cooked perfectly! They also had really great sweet tea. Not to bitter and not to sweet!! Ill be back for more, and preferably in Brittany's section!

HKnYlgnfy5MtyvZAWWmytg.text: We decided to have lunch here today, after passing it numerous times. My wife had the osco boco (Pork Shank) with rice and broccoli. She loved it, and I tasted it, Wow! I had the fish and chips, batter was made with Samuel adams, lived the fish and had a big portion for me. My daughter had a cheeseburger. It was all delicious, well prepared. It is one of the better places I found to eat around here. We got dessert for our 1st time here. My manager came by and welcome us. But espically the waiter we had ( Yancy). He was awesone, give him a raise. We will be back for sure, maybe dinner tonight. Lol But sure to check this place out, and so many tv for sports & drinks!

3FWpkKY3txiwRXax0NvQ7A.text: Fantastic food at reasonable prices! Our server, CJ, was the very best! The chicken nachos were enormous and TONS of sports on tvs, which are ALL over the place! LOVE this bar!

KrtIyVZaCQC3uQ22g49LWw.text: Went there tonight. The food was great as well as the atmosphere.. Great Staff.I had their famous zingers(like chicken tenders) very tasty with the blue cheese sauce..Will definently be going back.

AB3zDcu1_Iutg2bzkCsTRA.text: Went here with my husband and a friend.  The loaded fries were so good and the portion was huge!  The burgers were really good.  I had the Asian Chicken and it was delicious!  Service was great.  We will definitely be back.  They have a ton of TV's.  Just wondering if they play hockey games...

Nl7pnDBG7mLJ8huZIsaR7Q.text: This is a great place to go to for good food and good atmosphere. We have been here twice and the service and food is excellent. Can't wait for baseball season!

DI7-UGM2CDsSKB6NP8NomQ.text: It gets a bit crowded but the staff handled it well. The food was great, adorable prices and lots of drink choices.   I like that it's close to me too. It has all the sports games playing which is good to know for football season!

w7P2P6addzUe12ZaQCqDSw.text: We were thrilled that a new location was opening as we had stopped going to the Miller's in Town Square because it was continually over-crowded during the UFC Fights and people were just rude making it impossible to enjoy the fights. It's pretty much the same set-up as the other location but service was spot-on! Our server was very mindful of stopping by, refilling our drinks and making sure we were happy with our food. Tables were spaced out and we didn't feel like sardines during the UFC Fight. We did determine that, as non smokers, it's not a good idea to sit by the windows overlooking the patio area as the smokers seem to mingle right by the window even though the outside seating area is further away.   My only complaint is that they have done away with the raw bar which, besides the UFC Fight, was the only  reason for visiting. I loved their raw oysters as they always tasted fresh--better than some of the high end restaurants we've visited. Please bring the raw bar back!!!

xRvZKELTB9ecOfCN5UmvcQ.text: Great place to watch football they have so many tvs that it was easy to get a spot even on football Sunday. I like their low calorie options for the zingers!!! And the bartenders were not stuck up at all which is so nice being a female sitting at the bar to have cool girls behind the bar :)

lIsvRGJW12d6h3tKyFmVkg.text: Been here once and had to come back for the mojitos. $10 for a pitcher, you can't beat that and their appetizers are $5 during happy hour (except for two). But what makes it today is this bartender. Chris. He made my Mojito amazing. Last time I could hardly taste the rum, but this time I need a couple breaks. When you come you need to get their nachos. They are so huge and amazing. Well the first time they were, this time there's not that much meat on them but more chips than anything. Trying the spinach dip for the first time and its super good. Gonna continue eating, bye.

cxmoqxNKq4PG1FlcLBF_MA.text: From the hostess, waiter & manager you felt welcome!  They kept coming to make sure everything was ok, and refills kept flowing.   Food was good too.  First time here probably will be baxk

0fWv3X0KTRprgAmO5wqhHw.text: I have come here a few with my boyfriend. We generally like to come here for the Monday rib special, to watch sports, and have drinks. Generally, we have good service however this last time was the absolutely terrible.   I work in hospitality so I understand complaining guests or if it's busy. But it really bugged me to see the place not very busy, and what appears to be a manager standing around by the bar talking to two different groups of guys and no one else. Two serves sitting down eating, leaving two bar tenders to run the place.   Our server only came up to our table to take our order. He walked past us multiple times avoiding eye contact. No other server offered service. I made more eye contact with the cooks than anyone actually on the floor.     The food was ok. I had the sea food Mac n cheese and the boyfriend had the ribs special. He said the ribs were watered down and they didn't put enough BBQ sauce on them(trying to get the waiter to bring a side of it would have taken another 20 minutes).  With this all being said, we will still come back here for the good specials. But let's hope we don't receive the same service.

AODshsOVKSAcCLc0EddLCA.text: Came here last night for their late night happy hour. We walked in an hour before closing, and stood at the host desk for probably five minutes. Nobody looked at us, greeted us, I don't think anyone even realized we were there. After standing there for a few minutes, we figured since there was no host we were supposed to seat ourselves. We chose a high top next to the bar so we were clearly in the line of sight of the bartender. We sat at the high top for easily ten minutes with no service. There was one server cleaning tables around the restaurant and the bar tender. After 10 minutes, I turned around in my seat to look at the bartender. We made eye contact, but still no service came. A few more minutes later, the only server in the restaurant finally asked us if we had been helped. We ordered water and told him we were ready to order (being that we had been there for 15 minutes already).  We ordered the happy hour calamari, spinach dip, and zingers. All of these items were $5. The food was really good! I give the food five stars. The calamari was tender and crunchy, not chewy at all. For it being a bar and late at night, I was extremely impressed with their calamari.   The spinach dip was also equally good. You can't really go wrong with spinach dip, but regardless it was tasty. It was thin enough you could scoop it and it stayed really warm.  Lastly the zingers, what they're known for. I ordered them well done cause I enjoy a nice crisp, and oh man they were good. We got sweet Thai chili and medium on the side since we were sharing. Both sauces were very good. And even though I asked for the chicken well done they were still juicy.  Back to the service. We ate our meal with no water refills (and my boyfriend likes to be the guy sucking loudly on an empty cup for emphasis we need water), even after the server came over for last call. Last call for food? Understandable. Water would've been nice. We decline dessert and ask for the check. The server brings it, and we wait for him to pick it up. We wait and wait and wait. We grow tired of waiting and ultimately take the check book over to the server, who is preoccupied with cleaning. We're finally able to leave, and nobody says goodnight, goodbye, or thank you.  Over all, food is 5/5. The unfriendly unhelpful bar tender, 0/5. Our server, while friendly but extremely preoccupied and unconcerned with our service, 2/5. For a restaurant to branch out to Henderson with SO many other bars and good eats in close proximity, service should be great to keep locals coming back. As someone who lives on Stephanie, I'm very doubtful I'll return because clearly guest experience doesn't matter here.   Get it together, Miller's!

iPWLDPjo3_kknlNCURq6CA.text: Been here twice and I honestly do not know why this place is standing, let alone in a place such as Townsquare. I honestly believe if it wasn't for the "ALE" part of the name this place would fall to pieces. The food is extremely below par, always cold, flavorless, and sloppy. Service was great but I will not be making another try at this place. They need to completely change their recipes that include the lack of said factors above.

XPHbrTf4575GVr8SZ7oqxQ.text: Had a great experience at Millers Ale House. Food was served hot and everything was on the plate that should be. Servers were attentive and food was delicious. Will eat there again.

nmYDrVfhzx34K8-J44TOOw.text: With outstanding specials, good food, and friendly service; I like to make Miller's Ale House my home for lunch or dinner. Since this location opened in 2014, I have caught Miller's Ale House act quite a few times. Never once did I encounter bad service or lousy food.       Miller's Ale House might as well be Miller's Versatile House. It really is the home of versatility. It serves as a diner, bar, and place to go to for dessert. There is not one but two bars that serve 32 beer and ale on tap, 33 bottled beer,  and an impressive selection of wine and liquor. The two bars provide a versatile setting to enjoy beer or wine. On a nice day, the patio is a nice spot to enjoy a drink. When there is a UFC event on TV it is enjoyable to hang out at the bar. My area of Miller's Ale House expertise is in the area of food in lieu of beer, wine, and alcohol.        Currently, Miller's Ale House is one of the best lunch options in the Las Vegas metropolitan area. Everyday of the week there is a different $5.99 lunch special until 4 o' clock. Sounds like a good deal? It gets even better. As I pen this review, there is a $2 off Yelp check-in special. The inexpensive $5.99 lunch special turned into a $3.99 lunch special. Add in a refreshing bottomless cold beverage, tax, plus tip; a full-service lunch is less than $10. From Monday to Thursday they serve dinner specials. In addition to the specials, they serve a soup of the day. Following this review the pictures include their lunch and dinner specials.      In recent times, I have explored the lunch special menu. On a recent Thursday, I tried the meat loaf special. The plate included a long serving of meat loaf with mash potatoes that was agreeable to my tastebuds. The following day, I ordered the fish & chips. The fish and chips were delicious yet fell short of the dinner portion that included cole slaw that I enjoyed in 2014. Regardless the portion was generous. One of the pictures below shows three large fish patties, French fries, two bowls of tarter sauce, and a lemon.      The fact that I joined the Miller's Ale House club is evidence it is a good restaurant. The neat thing is that on my Birthday they treated me to complimentary chicken zingers (chicken tenders). Being that Miller's is the Versatile House the six chicken zingers with ranch dressing tasted just as good to the steak sandwich and fries I enjoyed here in 2014.    Miller's Ale House has also satisfied my sweet tooth. I really enjoyed my tasting of their delicious Nutty Butter Ice Cream cake. I am a fan of Nutty Butter cookies, fudge, ice cream, and both peanut butter with chocolate sauces. This conglomeration of delectable ingredients produced a commendable dessert.     When it comes to service, the versatility no longer exists. The service has consistently been personable and fast. On the last visit, the waitress was telling me that this is one of the better restaurants that she worked for. The waitress from the day before recognized me and said hello. The waitresses never gave me a difficult time with the $2 off Yelp check-in offer. Furthermore, the Manager asked me how my meal was. I took that as a sign of management caring about the customer's experience.       The best thing about restaurants that provide a versatile menu of good food served by friendly people is that it makes return visits interesting. I would like to return on a Monday to try the Italian Philly lunch special or Tuesday for the lemon garlic shrimp zuccini special. If a seafood craving fails to lead me to Red Lobster or Joe's Crab Shack; I wouldn't mind chowing down a lobster. Or if my sweet tooth gets the best of me the Nutty Butter Ice Cream Cake would hit the spot. With all this variety it is uncertain what will bring me back. What is certain is that I would like to return to Miller's Ale House.

This location doesn't really have that same feel and I honestly don't think the quality of the good is very good when you aren't taking advantage of drink specials. 9IslI46CYrSczv_V2eTBWA.text: I had lunch at Miller's Ale House in Henderson with my friend and her daughter and the service we received from Jake, the food, and the atmosphere were all fantastic! We were starving when we went in the restaurant and Jake greeted us right away with a great big smile and informed us he would be our server. We told him we were starving and asked if we could get something quick and he suggested the garlic bread which was delicious and arrived quickly. Jake was extremely patient while we were trying to figure out what we wanted to order. Jake was very knowledgeable about the menu and convinced me and my friends daughter to get the Fettuccine with Broccoli and my friend ordered the Fish and Chips and we all agreed our food was fabulous. Jake was a great salesman and convinced us to get dessert and I had the Capt Jack's Buried Treasure (OMG), my friend had the Warm Apple Walnut Cobbler and her daughter had the Ghirardelli Chocolate Brownie Sundae and we all were in heaven with our desserts. Jake was very attentive throughout our meal, he always checked on us and was right there if we needed anything. Jake absolutely gave us the best service we could ask for.  Miller's Ale House comes highly recommended to family and friends for the fantastic service we received from Jake, the great food, the atmosphere, and Capt Jack's Buried Treasure!

gXC0zjA87EjrbWo3QNVx_w.text: The service was good...the food was not. I ordered the French dip. It was a few pieces of shredded bits of roast beef. 3xVjdKWyd2d3mlLgzQX3Lg.text: This morning we went to Millers to watch the Penn State Michigan game.  We arrived just as they opened at 11am and there were several other people waiting.    We sat at the bar and were greeted by Lisa the bartender.  She was very friendly and attentive.  I had a Bloody Mary which was only $2.75!  What a deal!  A double was $5.00!  As for food we got the chicken fajitas and the loaded fries.  My friend enjoyed the fajitas and they came out sizzling however the cheese fries were just ok.  They were served on a rather large plate and were spread out too much for all of the toppings to be on them if that makes sense.  We only ate about half of them.    Throughout the game I also noticed the manager interacting with the bartender and getting involved with the operation.  As a beverage manager myself I was impressed.  A lot of the time management just manages by walking around not doing much.  This didn't seem to be the case at millers!    Great service.  Ok food.  And a fun atmosphere.  I'll be back for sure!

Bo4jb47wEJUBs9wIgHEhnA.text: How can you not love Miller's Ale House? They have ALL the things and they do them ALL well!   Let's start with the service! This was my second time here and the staff is always ready to serve you and seat you quickly. Joel and I came in on a Sunday around lunch time. Our waitress Brittany was so friendly and made sure all our food and drinks came out fast.   The atmosphere is great they have several huge wooden bars and plenty of tables to sit at. They also have different kinds of seating higher chairs and tables, booths and regular chairs and tables. There is a place to sit for everyone whether you are a family (kids eat free Tuesdays ) or if your just there for drinks. Miller's has a great selection of music which I totally appreciate as well.  Now the best part The FOOD and drinks!Talk about selection. Boy, do they have it! They also have amazing daily specials when it comes to food and drinks. They have huge bars with lots of different beers on tap or if beer isn't your thing they have a book of ALL the cocktails. On this visit I ordered a Bloody Mary. Which was yummy! It came with a pickle, olives and celery as garnish. I also had a drink called an Orange Crush. Both drinks were perfect and didn't break the bank either! I can't wait to come back and do a Sangria pitcher ( it's only $10). As for food we decided on potstickers for an appetizer. They were tasty and had great garlic flavor. For our entrees I ordered the Southwest Steak Salad. It was HUGE! It came piled high with onion strings, lots of tender pieces of steak, corn, black beans, avocado and a spicy mayo dressing. I loved it! Joel choose the Philly Cheesesteak ( fully loaded) it came with tons of thinly cut steak, onions, mushrooms, peppers and of course cheese. It too was huge and full of flavor. What a satisfying and fun lunch!  Miller's Ale House is a great place if you want tasty drinks and food at a reasonable price. Plus the staff is so friendly and helpful you can't help but want to come back.

If you like beer they have a lot on tap.  The seafood mac and cheese was actually pretty good and portion sizes are more than filling.  The bar staff was friendly but seemed harried and it was difficult getting their attention for our check.   For a bar to watch a sporting event this would do the trick.

The service was great and the food was great!  I was a happy camper!   Sidenote:  I was shocked to see it was a "family establishment" - even kids were welcome.  Not sure how I feel about them inside a huge sports bar, but that's on the parents.  Just seemed strange.  I'll go back fo sho.

Kw21zr3Rz1Bg4pzLEn1h6A.text: After several visits to Miller's on Las Vegas Blvd. with good experiences, when friends suggested meeting them at this location, we agreed.  Service was poor.  Our water glasses were never refilled.  We ordered the twin lobster tails, 2 orders of the fried shrimp, 1 order of the shrimp tacos.  When the food came, the lobster had a fishy, horrible ammonia order.  When we told the server to take it back, she said, "I thought it smelled bad, as well!"  What?  Really?  So, why did you bring it to the table if you knew it was bad?  Bad choice!  The two fried shrimp dishes were served with a tiny cup of cocktail sauce and fries.  One order had a heaping amount of fries and the second only had a few small pieces.  The fries were lukewarm.  We asked the server twice to please bring additional cocktail sauce.  She said, "well, that comes from the kitchen!"  Well, go to the kitchen and get it, please!  After at least a 10 minute wait, it was brought out.  By then, the shrimp was cold.  Fail! The shrimp tacos were bland and flavorless, with little shrimp, but a lot of shredded cheese.  Very disappointed, we won't be back!

Smtb3iFMqwYVD3MjgASQDw.text: I like this place. Been here twice. The food is average, or maybe a little below average. But the drinks are great, the atmosphere is awesome, and the staff is amazing. This place is clean and very spacious. Never had to wait to be seated. They have over 20 flat screen tv's so whatever sport or team you want to watch, I'm sure you'll find it there

Bz6nKtO-tyrkfLOfVIKTtA.text: If you look at my profile I don't really give people bad ratings reviews. But I think it's important to know when you're spending money at a restaurant quality of food you're getting in the service. This restaurant was sadly disappointing and we won't return.   My husband and I decided to go last night which is the day after Valentine's Day for laid-back Valentine's Day dinner. The atmosphere is a typical sports bar and was fun and inviting. We were told the wait would be 15 minutes so we sat at the bar for a drink. The bartender was friendly and the drink came out promptly. Lots of TVs made it easy to catch a game or the UFC fight if we wanted. As we continue to wait 20 minutes went by and still no one came to get us for our seat we waiting additional five minutes before going to the hostess desk and as were walking up with the manager said "oh there you are we will go ahead and place you in your seat now." It's funny that they didn't know where we were when the hostess was the one who set us at the bar. Anyway, we sat down and looked at the menu we ended up ordering within two minutes of seating. Our drinks came out and after another 20 minutes of waiting we still haven't gotten our meals. The waitress came about and said I'm so sorry but I threw away your ticket can you remind me of what it was that you ordered sir. My husband explain that he wanted the nachos and inquired how if she threw away the ticket my Caesar salad had arrived. She said should probably work on getting our food out. We waited about another 30 minutes before meal finally came. The problem with was that two other tables got seated after us and receive their drinks in their food in their entirety before we did. We didn't complain considering we were just there for a chill laid-back dinner but in general that's not good service.  Now it's crunch time. Now it's time to see if the food is worth the money! I dig into my fajitas and as I look on my sizzling fajita plate there literally was not even half of a full chicken press cut up on my plate. I wish I should've taken a picture. Sadly disappointed I kept my mouth shut because at this time I was starving. I dig into my fajitas and their basic. They are lackluster. It tasted like cheap tortillas from the grocery store and fake cheddar cheese. My guacamole on my plate was kind of turning brown which is not appealing. There was literally nothing in those fajitas that were Yum worthy. I got bored with my food and start eating my husband's nachos and again nothing spectacular. All in all I have to say with lackluster food and not so good service my husband and I will not be returning to this restaurant. You would get better rest restaurant quality food and better service at a local Applebee's then you would hear. And that's something to be said considering I hate Applebee's

YlzKj355j0vH-_3Wr8Swjg.text: It's hard to give a two star review when this place is packed even on weeknights.  My friend and I were here a few nights ago and made the mistake of ordering salmon and mahi-mahi. Both had to be sent back- the salmon because it had a very strange chemical flavor and the mahi-mahi was dry and overdone with absolutely no lemon butter as requested.  There was no topping of any kind. The Caesar salad had a very strange  dressing that tasted  unpleasant and not at all like the typical Caesar dressing should taste. I guess we just ordered the wrong food at this restaurant. This is a beer and burger joint and we should've stuck with the favorites.  The atmosphere however is perfect if you have a few friends with you and just want to hang out especially on a Friday or Saturday night. Can't complain about the service and certainly can't complain about the decor and the ambience. Looks like a fun place but when it comes to the food stick with the typical bar menu items. This place is very very noisy because it seats about  500 people so don't expect to have a quiet conversation. We had heard that a few times before so we knew what to expect.  Check it out for yourself you may like it, we didn't. Someday we give  it another try and this time maybe stick with what we should've ordered the first time.

U8-ZHUFGKOzmYzelxDzB0g.text: The chicken in my daughter's chicken salad was literally raw - just cooked a little on the outside - but pink and cold on the inside. In addition to being an incredible health risk, the waiter replaced the chicken but still charged us for the salad!

P6jl8E9ah4xBxxwi8v2prw.text: First time here. Stopped just because we were in the area. Nick is a fabulous waiter. Very friendly and attentive but not overbearing. Great selection of food. I had the Ossobuco, mashed potatoes and broccoli. My pork was HUGE!  Husband had the prime rib special! For $14 how big is the meat going to be right? Well it was perfectly cooked and enough to bring home for breakfast. We will be recommending Miller's Ale House to our family and friends!

vV-ZUu0Ys5XMfx65tQQ2HA.text: Unlike another customers impression my prime rib was succulent, flavorful and didn't cause me to wonder 'where's the beef?"  Hubby's pork shank met expectations as well!   Disappointment in a to go salad! The chicken and shrimp were over cooked amounting to about 2 ounces! I should have looked in the styrofoam container before leaving!  Admittedly the variety of menu selections brought smiles to our faces!   Service was better than expected given what I had read in other reviews!   There is room for improvement at this establishment... But we not saw reasons to be optimistic with engaging attentive management!

PmAj8Llw9Y0Y0bBebrhr8Q.text: Stopped in here after driving up to Henderson from Long Beach. We needed drinks and food. This place is huge but it was packed so I had my doubts. Places in suburbia tend to be blah.  Even still we got quick attentive service at the bar. Drinks were 3$! (Vodka and sodas)   The bartender let me sample a couple beers - always a plus for me. How else will I know if I want to drink  a whole one?  The food me and my bf had was all good. French dip and sliders with fries.  If I lived in that 'hood I'd definitely go back.  Extras: all the staff was friendly and the place was very clean, even the bathrooms ;)

gJc06trDN2qpW0oO3eDYZQ.text: Good beer selecting and decent food. Their turkey burger is my favorite,  followed closely by the zingers salad. The staff is super friendly and they can accommodate large parties  We often watch soccer in their bar area. It's a fun atmosphere.

4Ir2w3eaEch_fnTCWe1kxQ.text: We went here ST PATTY DAY for corned beef & cabbage...and truly the service was OUTSTANDING! Our server Matthew went above and beyond, from making sure we got to watch the Rangers, being extremely attentive, to, explaining the senior special, and adding green color to my Margarita to make it festive!  He even found rye bread to add to my corned beef dinner! The corned beef wasn't the greatest, however it didn't matter as everything else was superb thanks to Matthew! We did also have the Buffalo shrimp appetizers which were awesome and had some delicious peanut butter crunch ice cream pie that completed the night! Matthew was so nice my husband didn't care the Rangers lost! Fun night.... definitely recommend this place!

WhR6aVJoCk8XHY2TZBsqAQ.text: This is our absolute Go-To spot for Sunday football- the food is good and consistent, the beers are always cold, they have great specials everyday, and our regular servers (Jose and Alena) make us feel like valued friends. We look forward to coming here every week!

S3TbeEiD5JeysZkmvUT2jw.text: Love love love this place, That's where I spend my entire NFL season as well as being a regular throughout the year. Friendly Staff, Great prices and food quality is on point. Want to meet cool locals?? Head to Millers

ddiJon8MuL5WkD90osWA8A.text: Awful! The steak was raw! Not rare but raw!!! They tried to grill it again to a medium but it came out again as rare! The only reason why I'm giving them a star was because the service was good. We don't think we will ever be back.

qJyqgOG76Gi_mlfua_zfqA.text: Its not about what happens but how you handle it. Yesterday I was having a long day and I decided to stop by Millers Ale house for dinner because they were open late. I was greeted by the bartender Summer and the manager Ryan stopped by to check in with me because she was busy. I ordered the Southwest Bistro Steak salad. It tasted amazing. So much so that I ordered a carry out of the same thing. Towards the end I noticed a hair in my food... EEEWWW butttt this could have happened anywhere. The manager Ryan was very apologetic and took care of my bill. He ensured me that this does not happen often and was very empathic towards the situation which was nice. Despite the hair I would have still given them a 3.5 star for the customer service and cleanliness but the night got worse. Once I got home I immediately felt sick and realized I had a case of food poisoning. I'm sad to have to give a bad review because the food was very tasty and the staff was nice but today I am still feeling ill.

jUH4GLlTfdg39i-5vtp6kg.text: The only reason I'm even giving three stars is because the food was good & fast.   From walking into the door and being great by 'breana' in the most unprofessional way. Usually hosts are supposed to be smiley and upbeat to start your dinner off right, I guess she must of missed that part of orientation. The server we had, greeted us nicely but when we said we only wanted a salad, he quickly changed his demeanor.   I must say, I love Miller's, but I will not be going back to this one any time soon. I'd rather make the drive to Town Square and be treated properly.

zg6XR1Vh0GmNlSpOYTFFWQ.text: We ate here recently. We ordered prime rib. My husband ordered his med well. His meat arrived rare. The server gladly took it back, then the manager returned with it well done? Oh boy she was clearly annoyed when my husband asked again for medium well. I mean she looked mad. She gritted her teeth and agreed the bring him another piece of meat. The server was very nice and did a good job. We were taken back by the managers reluctance.

Ls0Egq-OjpMUYmOIh-9PcQ.text: Came here for the first time. Absolutely wonderful. Great food, good prices and huge portions. Service was great also, nanager even visited the table  because he knew it was our first time there. We will definitely be back.

Su0avlsryR6-AxYYsduidw.text: My husband and I were sitting at the inside bar on Saturday night watching the UFC fight (as we do for most of the UFC fights) the two bartenders (Annie and Colby) must have been new... trying to get a drink was nearly impossible. Annie took my empty glass away from me and continue to walk around the bar. I've bartended for many years, when there is an empty glass in front of someone you ALWAYS ask if he/she would like another drink. I thought maybe she would come back after she made her way around the bar.... NOPE!! So I then decided to start my timer on my phone. It took 28 minutes and 25 seconds to get another beer. During the time I was waiting to get my next beer I had to share my husbands beer. If I am there watching another UFC fight and I see either of these bartenders, I will not stick around.

nK9QhVEdJwLigW4CjW7CgQ.text: I came into Miller's after a hard days work I was tired and frustrated and still had work to do. As I was seated I opened my laptop up that's when I heard a welcoming voice "how are you" my server Jamie approached my table and was so kind and soft spoken she immediately asked what I was working on when I shared that I was involved with the school district Jamie opened up about being a mother and shared her views with me! Never have I felt more welcomed and more warm when dealing with a staff member. Truly this brightened my day changed my mood for the better and over all made my day. If I could give more stars I would! If you ever come to this restaurant ask for Jamie!!!

cIndF7IU60RWdR8WFRq1Tw.text: Great place to watch UFC games, good vibe, great happy hour deals and the drinks and food are delicious!

W8ROP3zLDYvovruKfgdsWg.text: It's a nice clean sports bar. The hostesses were great. Our waitress Chantelle was okay; a bit impersonal, but I suppose she did her best. However, she still managed to earn the 20% tip.   I had the French dip. The meat was very tender, the bread was soft but not overly soft. The aus jus sauce was delicious and not overly salty. I think I did well in my dinner choice.  My brother had the Turkey Burger and was very disappointed with it. He said the burger was greasy, the cheese was cold and he ended up nauseated after the meal.  Don't let my brother's experience inhibit you from visiting this awesome local Henderson eatery. He can be a wet blanket quite often and a very picky eater.  Although I live in the area, this was my first visit to Miller's Ale House and since my brother was visiting from out of town I figured Miller's would be a great choice. The price of the meal for two people, including drinks and tip, was very reasonable .  I am definitely adding Miller's as one of my local watering holes.

SsTqhmvOQbteHzcA7VJ49w.text: Trash. How can a steak start off well done then in a corner be rare. It would be a compliment to call this mediocre.

gAwXwiU4vOkRCZXeAzXuxg.text: Came here with my wife to have some drinks. The establishment was clean and not crowded. We liked that they have a variety of beer on tap. Its a nice little place to chat and have some drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. Its going to be a blue moom

A2A0rSoMAW3UL4pLM4uWDw.text: I absolutely love Miller's! The service is phenomenal and exceeds expectations -- from the hostess, to our waitress, and to the manager who came by to check that we were enjoying our meal. The food is also seriously amazing. I definitely recommend the fish and chips. The fries are crispy, the fish is crispy, it's all gloriously perfect and crispy. It's also an ungodly, American-sized portion at a very affordable price. I swear it's enough to feed two.  Other major pluses that I love: their vegetarian menu, their cocktail menu, and their extensive beer selection. Overall, I think it's such a great place to drink and chill with friends without making your bank account cry. Definitely recommend!

wg1gFiaZSJf_TxqM-gN7fw.text: My favorite aspect of this restaurant was the service I received from Courtney.  She was really wonderful and significantly enhanced my first visit with her cheerful exuberance and friendly and gregarious attitude.  I'm a vegetarian and this chain doesn't really cater to vegetarians very much, but they do have a few items that are vegetarian-friendly such as the vegetable fajitas with black beans and rice, linguini primavera, and the Gardein chipotle black bean burger.  I had the Gardein chipotle black bean burger but found it somewhat disappointing as it didn't seem to have much flavor.  The burger normally doesn't come with sauce and I'm a sauce fan so I received a side of their garlic crema which normally goes on one of their other burgers.  This helped the burger but this also didn't seem to have enough flavor to it.  They do offer guacamole for an additional charge as another option to enhance the burger.  The accompanying seasoned fries were really good, though, and did have nice flavor, without the seasoning being overpowering or overly salty.  I look forward to trying their other vegetarian dishes in the future and recommend this restaurant for it's wonderful, friendly service, and enjoyable atmosphere.

iMSMC_rIs10qHNGCsC843w.text: Old fashioned sport bar, with a lots of wood & brass, and TV screens all around. I went with a group of colleagues and has a chance to sample dishes beyond what I ordered. All the food was pretty good; great chicken fingers (crunchy outside, juicy inside, great seasoning), likewise great shrimp popcorn, and pretty solid nachos. I ordered a Cajun Chicken Pasta that was delicious, except that it was not what I expected a Cajun pasta to taste like, but still very good. Service was friendly, however; the servers auctioned the plates and brought our lunch in three waves instead of all at once; which are two service faux-pas, hence the missing fifth star.

w-Pdtd3FYbslF78YExTGpw.text: We were visiting for the weekend from out of town to catch the Las Vegas bowl game. We ordered an appetizer of mozzarella sticks, a few kids meals, burger and a grilled chicken sandwich. The food did not disappoint. Our server, Jamie provided excellent customer service. Refilled our drinks before they were gone and interacted with our kiddos ages 2&4.  Thank you Jamie! You were wonderful.  Great food and customer service, you cant go wrong with that.  We will definitely be coming back the next time we visit Henderson.

We will definitely be back as a group, and I will be taking my family there as well.

Ordered a burger with toppings and OMG it was cooked perfectly! Sweet potato fries came with a cinnamony butter dip which reminded me of Cinnabon. Not too much into sweets but it was good. Staff was friendly. Great service team!

_33ySOzLW-4fepL7Vmpvog.text: I really enjoyed the Millers Ales house at Town Square so I was glad when they opened one in Henderson.  Upon arriving the hostess was not very friendly.  We greeted her because she just stood there leaning on the hostess station staring at us.  I will say that was the only down fall. We ordered the Calamari as an appetizer and it was EXCELLENT.  Our main entrees were clam bake, and the zinger pizza.  Our server "Skylar" even suggested an alternative option for the pizza because my husband doesn't like blue cheese.  Skylar was actually very nice and attentive.  Over all great experience.

01BPdWN4VkeaiqIo2G5RtQ.text: We went to Miller's Ale House for my wife's Birthday, the good was amazing as a matter of fact my brothers kids talked about how they want to go there again, my brother ordered the fried shrimp plate it was a huge portion, he loves fried shrimp but of course who doesn't and he couldn't believe how much shrimp he got. I enjoyed my food also, the service great.

eqhdTJrgvZRDLPXYALvOeQ.text: Me and a group of friends all found out that we had nothing to do on Easter morning and decided to have an early lunch and a few drinks at Miller's Ale House.  This was a first time for all of us and it definitely hit the spot.  Service was very good (especially for a major holiday and earlier in the day).  We ended up getting pretty much every single appetizer on the menu, a few pitchers, and a few bloody mary's.  It was all traditional bar appetizers (mozzarella sticks, calamari, nachos, etc) and hit the spot.  It came out quick and the the waitress made sure we were never waiting for any extra condiments or drink refills.   The outside patio area was definitely one of the better features with a lot of TVs and a good selection of games/tournaments on.  I'll probably consider coming back for a full dinner with the missus here soon just because of how great the service was and the fact that they have a comfortable semi-outdoor seating area.

Oo7TpeBMHXgQmp81peQpVA.text: I've eaten at this miller quite a few times and the food is always great and love the day shift bartender adina that's where we usually sit to eat service is great food is good would definitely recommend this place for lunch or dinner

hJpK57hOCgc4jyX4BRyC2A.text: Been here a few times now. I love their setup when you first walk in. There's a map in the front to show you where you can sit, to see what game you want to watch. The food is good, and servers are great.

tEIq-5OWE6cl2sg9I5nPEA.text: Im a nice guy so ill give it a 4 and thats all thanks to the FOOD... cant go wrong at all it sucks they let go of the Porterhouse but the Rib Eye is very decent for the $... would have been a 5 STAR BUT NEW YEARS EVE service me and my girlfriend had was TERRIBLE even the manager cant even apologize for wrong order and missing ordered food... our waiter came back ONCE for the check and my 1st refill... and its DEAD New Years Eve smh I always get good service at Millers Ale House across the country and this is my neighborhood one... oh I was also charged for the WRONG TABLE... smh... pA7u8vGdJK8ETQLao9LnFw.text: We went here the first week they opened and had a poor experience but a few months later gave it another try and were very impressed with the huge improvement and have been going back ever since but like all good things they come to an end (So Sad)... Not long ago Miller's sold out to corporate which is the beginning of the end. We went there shortly after the chance and WOW!!!! What a huge change and not for the better... We ordered two of our favorites Cobb salad and onion rings.. We were informed they were out of onion rings and were being taken off the menu how disappointing. We received our salad and were in AWE of drastic change from what we were used to getting. A Cobb salad that used to be bountiful and filling was now meager and weak at best. We chalked this up to management change ate left hungry and went to good ol standby McDonald's. We've gone back one more time with similar results. Onion rings still on menu but the Cobb salad was even weaker. This salad at one time would feed us both no problem along with onion rings and a enteree all for reasonable price. Now we would have to order 2 salads to get same amount. Another example of corporate greed. Good luck Miller's with your corporate future. WE WON'T BE BACK!!!!!

yAowM1fIMqYSaQz2iSV--A.text: Went with a group of six. We ordered appetizers so we were excited to have it. 45 minutes go by, no appetizer and no Waters's to be found. _qvMV3KiWus8AKsMzarKFQ.text: One of the few off-Strip sports bars to carry all of the UFC fights- came here for the Rousey 190 match. Food is fairly decent, but nothing I'd cross town for on it's own. Service was attentive and food/drinks came out quickly despite the crowd.  ZINGER MOUNTAIN MELT: Basically it's chicken strips on a mound of fries, accented with cheese, bacon bits, and green onions, with ranch. Ultimate bar food, easily split among 2-3 hungry people without regard for their waistlines or cholesterol. The chicken was just okay, hardly something they should be considering a signature dish. The fries and various toppings took on the flavors of a baked potato, which was kind of fun. HOT WINGS: Standard bar wings, the "hot" sauce was fairly mild, and they twice brought out Ranch instead of the Bleu cheese dip we requested. Decent-sized order, about 10 wings. PEPEPRONI FLATBREAD: Very crisp flatbread, slight char to the bottom for flavor. There's a surprising amount of flavor packed into this order, with a thin but robust layer of tomato sauce, topped with cheese and a generous number of pepperoni. I appreciated that this wasn't greasy. ALE HOUSE SUNDAE: Two fist-sized scoops of ice cream (choice of chocolate, vanilla, or both) topped with the classic whipped cream, hot fudge, and cherry. Felt there should have been more fudge for it to be considered a sundae, but it was more of a decorative drizzle. Not that any of us needed this dish at all, shared or otherwise.  Beer selection is pretty good (had a nice shandy), prices are reasonable ($8 pitcher of margs special!), and if you sign up for their e-club you'll get a coupon for a free flatbread. Make sure to come for a game, the food on it's own isn't enough to really have a great visit.

Hjz-m6EyUJCDqPhiZstAQQ.text: let me start off by saying...my husband and I are not really picky eaters. But this place we both had terrible food. Two stars strictly for food. My husband wanted to get steak for his birthday dinner and in Las Vegas there are many many steak places to choose from but we were on a limited budget and wanted to get more bang for our buck. We live in henderson so after researching online for a while i came across the Millers ale house web page and there specials/prices seemed perfect for what we needed......fast forward to our dinner. Atmosphere great! down to earth sports bar crowed all good signs. we were walked over to the bar area in a separate room (ac was way better so again no complaint).  Waitress was pleasant and told us about the specials. They offer HUGE pounders for their drinks so again pleased that we don't have to have lots of refills. so far so good. My husband ordered 20oz porterhouse medium rare with baked potato and steamed broccoli and I ordered the Sunday special the Pasta Orleans.  My husband is a cook and one touch of his steak he knew it was overdone, potato was bare no butter no sour cream no nothing....and broccoli was rock hard on his plate and in my pasta.  my pasta was a mix of shrimp, chicken, broccoli, mushrooms, scallions, tomatoes in a Cajun Alfredo sauce. TERRIBLE....my noodles were so mushy i couldnt even eat them i basically just pushed them around on my plate and ate the chicken and mushrooms out of the pasta. The shrimp was slightly underdone and with all the stuff in it you would think lots of flavor but was just bland and yucky.  our waitress saw our distress and im not really a complainer in person (wink wink)  but when asked how our food was my husband told the truth and how he was unhappy with steak and overall food in general.  she offered to replace the steak and we said no due to wait time and just not really wanting it.  then a few min later the manager came over and asked us again if he could replace the steak, again we said no and he comped us for steak dinner. we didnt push for my pasta due to i ate all the things around the pasta and garlic bread.  so we paid our bill and still tipped the waitress cause she aint the cook and we left to Marie Calenders to pick up a truly fantastic french apple pie that made us finally smile.

4KlscHrRQ17vO0XoJXymnA.text: Upon entering my large group sat at their bar tables and was told by the waitress they don't normally serve food but they will make an exception to serves us there this time. We all wanted to watch the soccer game and was appreciative although it doesn't make sense why not. We didn't receive menus and had to ask and was told once again that they are doing us a favor...I was dying for them to tell me again bc I didn't hear the first two times...   Ordered a Caesar salad with mahi mahi. The lettuce was wilted dark brown in spots of more than half of the salad pieces. After picking them out I realize there wasn't too many fresh pieces and gave up and asked for a new one. After 30 mins of waiting some more, I asked the waitress to cancel it. My party was already done eating and I have no desire to keep waiting. My waitress was sweet and apologetic. They didn't charge me for the salad (they better not!!) but I tipped her for the service however, I won't be coming back for the food.   2 people from my group who ordered the Italian Philly sandwich both had stomach upsets after eating here. The 2 others who order that also was fine. Dine here at your discretion.

cI_Tfe6e9uU9fY3mztNwOw.text: Overall not impressed at all.  My wife and I were first received by a hostess who insisted on taking about a full minute to finish a conversation with another employee before even acknowledging our presence. We initially had an awesome server who swapped out with another later.  my wife ordered chicken fajitas.  They came out less than half the size of any fajitas plate i have ever seen before.  It consisted of a bunch of peppers and maybe about 6 very small strips of chicken.  They were quite dry and the presentation looked like someone bad spilled the left overs from a fajitas plate on the table and then just randomly shoveled it onto ours.  We very politely talked to Paul the manager about it and his response was "well i guess if you don't like it I'll take half off or something"  as he's still talking he turns his back to us and walks away.  This is a manager???  Overall a very sub standard and disappointing experience.  Servers were very nice and management needs to take at least a basic class in customer service.  I would not recommend this place to anyone who hopes to enjoy their night out.  I'm hesitating to give it 1 star.

wHYT5sn-lmZddu9QTPoZ7g.text: I'm from out of town so wasn't sure what to expect. The reviews didn't look promising but since I didn't get to pick where we ate, we ended up here. We had a very large party of about 25. They were very accommodating. I noticed that neither the restaurant or the bar area were busy for a Friday night. The bar area is separate from the dining area. There was a door separating the two like they were two large rooms. I'm not quite sure why, I've never seen anything like that but moving on...  The place is huge and has lots of seating even in the bar area. There's even a patio with a fire pit. Overall the restaurant is clean and spacious. That being said, the menu is short and nothing appealed to me or my sisters. The food is below average for bar food. We ordered the potstickers and the barbecue chicken flatbread. Neither of which were all that great.   I will say that they have a decent drink selection. I'd stick to the beer. The service here was great as well. Our server, Eric, is the reason I gave this place two stars instead of one. He was consistently checking up on the whole table and was very friendly. If I'm in the Henderson area again, this won't be on my list of stops.

e-IYsY0JiMhk2_Vo-3elrA.text: 113 degrees outside in Las Vegas and I was looking for a cool place with table service for my lunch. Drove by Miller's ale House. I have eaten at other Miller's Ale house locations for dinner but never could stop by for lunch before. The layout of the restaurant is very similar to the other Miller's that I had been to in the past. Relatively dim lighting, lots of televisions, very large bar in the center, and lots of booths around the periphery. As soon as I sat down, Shantei, my server came by to explain that they were specials available and to get my drink order. The lunch menu had lots of under $10 specials available, I chose to go with a chicken and shrimp Cobb salad. Outstanding choice! The presentation of the salad was beautiful. Loaded with all of the things you expect to see in a Cobb salad. I was surprised to see how generous portion of grilled shrimp was in the salad. The salad was fresh and had a good blue cheese dressing on the side. At just over $10, a very good value. Definitely will come back here again for lunch when I'm in the neighborhood.

I stepped away to use the restroom and mind you I decided to treat myself to lunch, she placed my drink behind the bar while I was gone. Props to this place for hiring excellent people! 6gBxuYrnwkSv011pPKuarA.text: I had an amazing meatloaf lunch with my friend Carl today! Excellent food and service at Millers ale house. Highly recommend it!  Manager Jeremy Danford came to our table and checked on us too! First class!

BN0CD3ZmA5TlUHS8sx3z4Q.text: Miller's Ale House - Henderson (2017 Yelp Review #235)  My bosses from out of town like Miller's Ale House for lunch because it's rarely busy on the weekday, there's enough on the menu to satisfy anyone, and the food is okay. The service has been great both times I've been here and the prices are decent.  The menu is comparable to what you'll find at an Applebee's, Chili's, and BJ's.  The difference is that the food here cost less and you get a lot more. Miller's Ale House even has a daily lunch special.  I've been to this location a few times and have tried their Chicken Caesar Salad and Salmon.  Both did its job and pretty much satisfied my hunger. The salmon is portion is average, but they're willing to hook it up if you ask nicely.  Overall, I really had no complaints and the service was great. Keep in mind that I wasn't here on a Saturday when it gets really busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. Mel C was here!

Qmg_yorMNIuUql8xShTnRw.text: I'm as regular as it gets.  Nice menu likely to appeal to anyone and 40+ beers on tap. Bar food, burgers, ribs, fish, etc and excellent specials all of the time and the best late night Happy Hour in town 10pm-12Mid Sun-Thurs.   All sports on 30+ Big Screens and all UFC PPV's are free.

yFlvDq9DDaTtuSAKDcTQLg.text: Actually this is the second time I have been here! The place looks awesome! Clean, casual ambience. The 3 stars is for my outstanding bartender/ server in the bar Timi. She rocks. She did have a small talk with us but very attentive.  But the food? Mannnn as I said I gave it another chance it's  just not working for me.  The first order I have  was the fish tacos . Ewwww it's too fishy and I can tell I tried a little bit of it but ekkkkk yuck. I know, why? I'm pescatarian. So I ended exchanging it to the blt lobster without the bacon. ( on a sourdough bread ) sigh I was disappointed. It would have been good but the amount of lobster and shrimp in there is about a tablespoon. Just all tomatoes and lettuce and some kinda cream sauce. Oh well. Still a good place to have a drink tho' and great screens to watch games. But what's up with the 50 gazzilion captain Morgan display at the bar... waaaah who is the Bar manager? Fix your inventory and do your displays accordingly! Just saying. HAppy Hour !! Come check it out!

ey5tqk7BV_qG_1SXHST1Ow.text: Love this place. Jason always greets me and make me feel at home. Food specials are great through the week. Good selection of beers

Z6ksZCQLrKHyu3A7-7Qk0Q.text: Lunch specials are awesome. Food was good with excellent selection. Staff was pleasant. Went for lunch and dinner. Only downside dinner, volume was really loud for the hockey game. We'll be back.

eVTshikO2kDxfJ5Pmpwu9g.text: First time here, food was beyond delicious! Not sure why this place does not have 5 stars. Everyone is super nice and very friendly. Patricia Our server was great! Def coming back again.

npoxjTAVsjCXhAlXxqJ5CA.text: I love this place and the Zingger mountain melt is phenomenal.  Today was a total miss after waiting over 20 minutes they delivered a cold, soggy and inedible product then made me feel like it was an inconvenience to remake it.  Then the server asked if I wanted dessert before we even got our retired food.  Also my server was not attentive and was to busy stocking tables with sugar and salt then to fill our empty cups.  For now on I'll just head to the Millers at Town Square they are always on point.
