efkHGCMVeNX51HrMvBvzoQ.text: Was pleasantly surprised with this place. First time here, had the zingers on a salad along with shrimp scampi with side salad. There were two of us. Dinner salad was big, a meal on it's own, good. Carlos a manager found out it was our first time and bought us a dessert,  apple crisp. Again pretty good. Lunch looks like a really good deal as well. Will come back.

xUeFGrElaMp-4s1ELFAuow.text: Came here on a Monday night. As soon as we walked in the hostess greeted us and sat us in a booth. Our server was Nathan. He was very knowledgeable with the menu and very accommodating. He even remembered our order by memory which I thought was impressive. He made sure our food and everything was okay. I had the baby back ribs. It was so delicious I didn't have any leftovers lol. Definitely coming back and trying some other stuff on the menu. And if you have Nathan as your server I'm sure he will impress you with his memory skills.

m7E0C6WdFbvNxuOlvRM_YA.text: Great food, Great service, reasonable prices... the bartenders are all very friendly, especially Lisa and Kori.  The GM Jerry is also very helpful if needed.  Highly recommended.

Yf9_VRzlKQXazY435I8Lcw.text: Went to millers for the NBA finals game 7. Got there about 15 minutes before game time and I was surprised at how we didn't have to wait for a table. Not saying that's a bad thing. We ordered the calamari and honey bbq zingers (chicken tenders). Both were very good. The bbq zingers were served with celery and ranch, both good portions. The calamari was served with an almost sweet chili sauce. Thought the calamari needed either a dipping sauce on the side or more of the sweet chili sauce but still very good. Our server was Jose, he's waited on us before, and he never disappoints. Such a nice guy, my drinks were always full, and he was very informed about the menu. If you are looking for a casual sports bar to grab a nice drink and some great bar food then millers is your place.

gsaXzUi0vrpojW7NjduqLw.text: The worst service I have ever received. After being seated we waited for 10 minutes before a waiter from another section asked if we had been taken care of. He took our drink order and told the waitress we needed to be waited on. When she showed up and took our order, she forgot to ask about my side. My meal came out pretty quickly, but the salad my husband ordered didn't show up for 30 minutes. When the manager came by to see how our meal was, my husband told him how long he waited. The manager told us he would check on what happened. We never saw him again. The ticket came without any adjustment, and in fact charged me for a soda I didn't order. We won't go back to this location.

SFTEHjopJbAHsXjmJOM1WA.text: I come here often with clients and it has always been a pleasant experience.  Today was no exception even with a game playing.  I still got top notch service.

photos.caption: Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. Having fun with hubby

HDrRJAmBnb9b9O4kswzI0Q.text: Overall, I really like this place. The appetizers are awesome, especially the nachos (both the fiesta and the chicken). Anything I've ordered there has always been good and their portions are large. I would recommend it to anyone. Also, you can't beat their $10 pitcher of Sangria (even cheaper during Happy Hour). Fun place to hang out and watch sporting events too!  Their nutter butter peanut butter ice cream cake is sooooooooo good. You have to try it.

QJsTIdzqTuYkb-Tjwwvjyw.text: Came here with two of my girlfriends for a casual lunch date. It was my first time at this location and I really enjoyed it. The food, service, environment was great. Steven was our server and helped with what I should order. I got the zingers and fries which were amazing. He kept checking up on us to make sure everything was good. Overall I would come here again when I'm in the area. Possibly during happy hour!!

NmQNdBftbd62xYF0RH-Yug.text: There are many restaurant options on Stephanie, but my girlfriend and I decided to go to Millers because we wanted to watch a few different college football games while getting some lunch. There are over 20 TVs in the patio area, so we decided to sit in that section. When we asked our waitress if she could put on the Oklahoma game, she said they are not changing TVs anymore. Whatever that means. Instead, we watched an infomercial on the Ninja coffee maker and the same Bama and Royals game on multiple TVs. What kind of sports bar is this? The food was good but we will never be back.

4M_h_Ijo6icKaTniQPo-5Q.text: I brought my boyfriend from chicago here and he couldn't believe the prices. $8 pitchers of beer, $2 cocktails (decent Captain Morgan not completely off the cheap truck brand) and food was also very cheap. We went three times just for the drinks and had a different waiter each time, all of them being friendly. Plenty of seating no matter the time and no matter what game is on or team playing.

lChFm8SF20X2VgdBSqkRWA.text: I came and ordered the Cajun Chicken Pasta, it seems like they should rename this item to oil and pasta, cause that's all it was. Tasteless, flavorless, oily pasta.

8AcYXFTf3uWZHPYROK1DVA.text: I didn't dig this place at all. I really hoped I would since I live so close. The food was pretty gross. Everything we ordered was the color of cardboard. We checked yelp before we went and saw a photo of a chicken wrap so since we felt like a wrap we thought why not give this place a whirl. Miss happy go lucky let us know that wraps are on their specials menu for Monday only. Seriously WTF. It's Saturday and I want a wrap today. We ended up getting chicken fingers and some kind of zinger flat bread. Both gross. I'm pretty let down. This place is a turn off, not sexy at all.

xQ_yCS-L15SXysISUbt8fg.text: Hello, I try not to write bad reviews however I was truly disappointed with this place.  I order a prime rib steak. It was cold when I got it. I asked for it to be refired but it was still cold. The Mac in cheese tastes like it was out of our childhood blue box and you ran out of milk..... No silverware on the table till after each corse was brought to the table no napkins happy hour drinks were horrible I just out it aside :(. The hot food was cold and the cold food was room temp. photos.caption: Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. I was extremely disappointed with the meal the steak was cold :/  hopefully this was a bad night and not a standard

by24OkdEuq3UEjHnubdkBQ.text: Excellent bar food and drinks.  Came for a work party and found the service and food to be great.  They have the usual appetizers and bar food.  The potato skins were my favorite.  The philly steak sandwich looked awesome and my friend confirmed it.

tVhG10x7hOQCpJkTUZhnbQ.text: Decent place to grab a bite at a chain restaurant. At least it is a chain that isn't rampant in Las Vegas and I'll go out on a limb here and say it is better than eating at a Chili's. But it is infinitely better than eating at an Applebee's.  Restaurant, menus, drinks, bar, service all ring True to "chain". You won't receive horrible food here, there's a decent menu with numerous options (heavy on fish items and the oddity of strange sampler platters/appetizers that restaurants like this have these days), and the place is clean, light, not too noisy (at least when we were there), and our server was actually very, very chipper.  Here's what was served to myself and my family, I'll make this quick:  Mahi Mahi Fishy - More like meh meh fishy. This was probably one of the worst, saddest pieces of fish I've ever eaten (minus when I try to make fish myself in my house which I hate because who wants to smell fish for the next three days after they cook it?). Anyway, I asked for it blackened and it came out lightly charred (??). I also opted for the mashed potatoes and gravy - OK.  35 Shrimp Alfredo - My husband's choice. There were 34 shrimp. That is all.  Steak & Boom Boom Shrimp - My brother's choice. He said it was good. I refrained from making fun of his Boom Boom Shrimp for about 40% of the meal.  Jambalaya (minus the rice) - My dad's choice. My dad is a on a no-carb diet and he ordered Jambalaya minus the rice. I had a bite, it was spicy, but missing something, not sure. Moving on.  Lobster Tail - Served with melted butter and veggies. My mom's choice. I did not get a chance to try it, she ate all of it. Selfish.  Drinks - Probably the best part. I got a Shock Top (lemon type flavor), hubby got two HUGE Blue Moons, and my father and I had shots of Jameson, that come with pickle juice as a back? Sure. Irish people gonna drink.  Desserts - Ridiculously indulgent, over the top monstrosities - whatevs, didn't stop me from eating them. We got two to split between the whole party - one was a Nutter Butter, peanut butter, chocolate thing, the other was a brownie sundae.   Overall - a place to go with my fam-bam because it's safe bet.

OxeYpAUy_Ojup_7gMGvtRA.text: I made my third visit to Miller's on Friday July 3rd during lunchtime. We were seated quickly in the bar area in a booth and told a server would be by soon to take our drink orders. After a bit of a wait we had our drink orders placed,( Ice teas ) and then soon we had someone else asking us what we wanted to drink.   After the server confusion was cleared up, we confirmed that the June specials were still in effect and both ordered the fish and chips for 4.99.  We could not have asked for faster service. I imagine that as soon as the order went into the computer, they plated our food.  It arrived hot. I had to ask twice for the ranch I requested for my chips, but the food was good. Especially for the price.   The decor is truly nothing special. After a week, I cannot remember anything to make note of. Its pleasant. The booths are not padded which is nice for a change. You do not sink into the seats from where other people have constantly sat.   The service was prompt and pleasant. They asked if we needed more ice tea and filled our glasses. The only thing I could say is that she failed to ask if we were interested in dessert before bringing our check. Considering the check total was already small, she could have tried to increase it. We might have tried a Buried Treasure or an Apple Crisp. I usually either get an appetizer or a dessert. Today I had neither because I wasn't asked.  Overall, Miller's is a fine place to eat. It's not going to be one of my "go to" places but I will be back. The prices are on the high side and they are serve good food. But its nothing to rave about.

KY6xSqK1lRoJrgMXgEQkxw.text: Food is easily 4 stars, some dishes maybe 5.  The service is great; the staff is very quick and attentive.  Matthew, our waiter, was really pleasant and great at his job.  The appetizers come out quickly.  The atmosphere is nice and upbeat.  Overall, a great experience.   However, I warn you.   Do not get the 35 Fried Shrimp.  They only included 34 (I counted 4 times).  This is deceptive advertising.  After complaining, he did get me the 35th shrimp plus 5 extra shrimp, so they made it right and were very polite about it.  However, you should be able to trust that the restaurant won't short you your shrimp.  Every shrimp counts.   UPDATE:  THEY STILL CAN'T GET THEIR COUNT RIGHT.   I was shorted AGAIN a week later and had to speaker with the manager AGAIN.  These people can't even count the number of shrimp and ensure their guests are treated fairly.  NOT ACCEPTABLE TO CHEAT THE GUEST.  I am editing this review down two stars because of a repeat mistake!!!

DCB050gozxys9Qq2YHkk0A.text: Been here several time for the friday lunch special, always seated quick and have had good service. When it comes to the fish and chip special, it is awesome , priced right and taste great. I am also a huge fan of the size of the soda cups, as some one that inhales soda , the cups here must hold 2x the normal restaurant  amount, so I don't have to constantly  ask for refills.  The building  is nice and open , lots of tvs , I think they have every sports channel  ever.

ecI0bEw3_NoFFNc_2Bc1sA.text: Food server not very attentive, did not ask why I did not like my drink did not offer another drink,food okay not good enough to return, hostess stayed by her station looked up and said Thank you but did not move, place was not busy at all. Need some more customer service training skills for the staff.

pTCr98J0KC5K1ZiOoLgA4A.text: Great neighborhood bar situation going on here.  I wasn't overly impressed with the bartenders, but they WERE really busy so the lack in personality is understandable.  Its very clear that there are a lot of regulars here - many friendly regulars.   Its a bit of a drive, but we'll be back!

tJ4B3YO5KwGp-i141-WM6w.text: Raw chicken sandwich. Sent it back with waitress. Never saw a manager. Very disappointed.

n0YsJH-LWJj3E49_iXRpTg.text: One of our favorite places! Friendly service, good food, great selection of draft beers, fair  prices and NO smoking! It's a nice place for dinner or for just some late night snacks and drinks. Lots of televisions with sports cover the walls along with mounted fish and fishing tackle, kind of weird knowing we live in the desert but it beats stuffed deer heads staring at us! The place is clean and you can walk out not smelling like you just fought a forest fire.

QWXAzX3yVBEVnmtium2-VQ.text: This is a cool place to eat have a drink and watch some sports. The food is pretty good and the service is good. Some of the waitresses are really nice and friendly. The fish and chips is awesome and you get a lot for the money. Most of the food is big servings so if you don't eat a lot you can share it with friends or have food to take home. The atmosphere is great and it is loud but that's fine with me.

lWCgULF0cy60hJ6Jyk--4A.text: Stopped here Saturday afternoon for an early dinner on a one day Vegas turn around.  Just happened to be driving buy and noticed it.  A new place that we hadn't seen before.  Glad we stopped.  Normal pub type food.  Good fish tacos and hand made pizza.  Great atmopsphere and the service was prompt and friendly.  And the beer.... nice and cold.  Definately wouldl visist here again.

4ufM6eZf8b6ZafuMV0Y6-A.text: Our server, "Maggie with the smile" is awesome and very friendly. This place packed on Friday night but we got out seats in less than 15 min...Wow!

6oitZOwF3_RJ_bnhd0YXZw.text: Sit at the bar in Napua's section! She is awesome and so friendly, great service at the bar! Love millers!

PFloPZ6XVB4lKn-oIdwchQ.text: Things continuously get better here. I had a blackened turkey burger that comes with sauteed onions and mushrooms and your choice of cheese. To my delight all of the burgers here now come on brioche buns... Yup brioche!

Pd3EDUbkMYgw7tWLOuDw-w.text: A friend told me about Miller's and their Cobb Salad.  Well all she said was True.  It was fabulous.  A good filling portion.  Returned a second time and had the Blackened Chicken Key Lime salad and it was fabulous. Each time we shared a dessert and both were deliciously good.  When entering, both times, the hostesses seemed a little distracted and somewhat stand-offish.  The servers each time were pleasant and checked on us regularly.

RVeS_PMiOObOt9uL4SvdHw.text: My only complain about the place is the bartenders. If you are sitting at the bar be ready to be ignored. I see you are busy and I don't expect you to serve me right away but at least acknowledge me. We had 4 bartenders walk by us and neither one said "hi, I'll be right with you". My husband and I went out to dinner on a Saturday night. It was busy. The hostess said our wait would be 30 min. but we got seated in about 20. The waitress was nice and friendly. Beers were icy cold. The fried calamari was delicious. The best we've had. My husband had a fish sandwich and I had the BBQ ribs. Everything was very tasty. I can't wait to go back and try out more stuff on the menu.

sMqPc3REWyVSRdbQnVMytw.text: Great place for  dinner or just a night out with friends. Everyone very friendly. Harley is a great cook. He works in the kitchen. I seriously recommend this place. ......

ZqCTTQphWcrplEsinIzisw.text: If you don't get Marissa as a server you might get screwed, she's the best!!! Restored my faith in Miller's Ale House!!! That Julian though seems shady

oocSqZFI045eTJkTMDTe7g.text: Fish tacos were fair but the beer selection was good and the sports bar atmosphere was great. I would defiantly go back to watch a game and have a few beers and dinner. Service started out strong then fizzled but the staff was friendly.

8q6sQoiwtOjF6hqwP3NShg.text: A friend and I eat at this restaurant occasionally and have had decent service and food but on May 7th this was not the case!  The server, Jasmin, was very nice but the food was terrible.  The onion rings were served cold (which we sent back) and my french dip looked like someone sat on it! When I asked to speak to a Manager, a heavy set man came over and he was rude and confrontational. He stood over me glaring at the plate and said, "Well, what's wrong with it?"  We are not complainers but as his smart mouth questioning continued, he tried to jerk my plate out from under me so he could replace it with another sandwich.  I told him I didn't want another sandwich and he replied, "Then what DO you want?"  I said, "NOTHING!"  All I wanted was to let him know that the chef is doing a bad job!  That should have been his first concern! He should have offered to adjust my tab accordingly but all I wanted was for him to apologize and acknowledge the sandwich looked horrible. He had no respect for me and no customer service skills whatsoever. Definitely not a good way to run a restaurant.

EtoOah6Uk3qaTFr7i95AoA.text: How is this place still open????? The hostess couldn't even decide where to sit us. We asked for outside seating and she sat us at the back bar... Then we patiently waited 15 min not a single bartender or waitress even acknowledged that we were there. The one bartender did flirt with a guy at the bar long enough to exchange numbers. We would have sat it out if they were busy or if we were offered even a water. But how can you be open when your ignoring your guests on a dead Monday afternoon at 4 pm????

kRV89WXAe8hgO2n5Vu8gFw.text: WOW! WOW! WOW! We had the best time this afternoon. Having to decide where to eat after a long day at work is not exactly what I want to do.  My sister suggested Miller's Ale House.  We have been here before but not at this time of day.  Everything about our experience here today was perfect and at the top of that perfect list was Jillian; our server.  What a delight.  It's obvious she loves her craft as she accommodated us in every way.  We are quite demanding as we have been in the food business for years. Jillian said up front that she will take good care of us and she catered to our every need.  She is so personable and completely knows the menu and all of the specials.  She did have quite a few other tables to take care of and I noticed that she was equally nice to everyone.  What a gem Miller's has in Jillian. We will be going back very soon during her scheduled work days.  Thank you again Jillian for making our experience so enjoyable. Natalie B.

Gm_qUIQE57B2HKXuhQd-sA.text: Zingers are great but they can't be your meal every time you go.  Food is very salty and the menu is standard for a sports bar type restaurant.  Lots of beer choices, lots of cocktails and large portions for the food.  For quality, go elsewhere.

iOXzHoYbSvvY12bSQO8NPg.text: They have good pastas and sandwiches, they have wifi, most of the services is good. Reasonable price. Daily special price for special menu. Comfortable place. I love this place

4KEptvfyu4-PSMycF_h6aw.text: I have been coming to this location since they opened the doors. Service and food have yet to disappoint. Lobster Lunch Wednesdays are just AWESOME! service is great and great atmosphere. Great place any time of day!

3c3OHKmXEnuHg84qr5uNHA.text: This is my ultimate favorite restaurant/bar in Henderson! Food is always great, the experience as a sport fan is phenomenal, and the management and staff are A1! Tony and Jasmine are always on top of things and are there everytime I come in. They make you feel like family :) I can't wait till football starts!!!

XoSy9cuvXQIvCdF-riZj8w.text: I ate here because of the variety on the menu and we don't have places like this in so cal. Harris Ranch steaks for under $20, seafood, and great beer selection. Henderson has a ton of sports books and gaming sports bar/restaurants, however, this place is great because noooo gaming. It feels special, and yum. the Lagunitas IPA was 7.50, which is a scam! Anyhow, we all enjoyed. They have 35 shrimp for 20 bucks. good stuff. I would go again. Its not fancy, but cool! the service was awesome too. PS The water glasses are like 42 oz. lol all the way to hydration land. Lake Mead is drying up, its kinda wasteful.

Bw9my3rLVRJA1aOdIo8uFg.text: Mixed feelings! I love that outdoor sitting area with tv and fire pit. Food is great! Prices of drinks and food is reasonable. But.. Service sucks! The first time I went, I sat outside for an hour without being helped. I called the manager and he sent me a $50 off my next visit. I tried it again. This time I sat for 20 minutes before I went and go someone's attention to come serve me.

HuQOgsIkfZthM8xSX1Ku-Q.text: Definitely enjoyed the atmosphere & watching my Giants win the World Series! Food & drinks were good, plus service was excellent. Skyler was the best!

z0HuaqwVM3LpZTIKcb2m4Q.text: Finally a Miller's in Henderson. Great place to eat, watch your favorite sports game. $8 pitchers of Budwiser, can't beat that. Highly recommend you visit this place.

ZwpjZKb--CznpP6m-2JS_g.text: Wife was craving fish and chips.  Nothing else would do.  After being directed here by two previous restaurants without them on their menus we came and were very satisfied.  The fish was beer battered Hake and delicious!!!  Hubby had chicken Caesar Salad that was very good.  We'll go back!

xOHpWtfdGUDYyrPak0Ymwg.text: The food and as are ok..  But you get seated and you have to ask the bartender to orted food.. really..    There's 5 or 6 people at the counter where the food comes out and your standing their till you ask someone for some service..

Zld8wuEKH18dUdhxUPVC5A.text: Love this place. The weekly specials are tasty and a great value. The service is exceptional. I have never had anything that did not taste good here. This is a great place to come for a game and enjoy some good food.

Lpnxaq6KTUxciJVHedEVEQ.text: Nice place, food is average, service was fantastic! I won't be driving out of my way to come back here, but it was okay since it was close by. The nacho appetizer was a great meal for two, but stay away from the soup in a bread bowl! The bread was old and stale and the soup was tasteless.

EB469lao34lYLgBRlcgdkA.text: Just went there last night for the first time.  The zinger melt was amazing,  and the booths are nice with plenty of space,  but the waiter wasn't too knowledgeable. I'll definitely go back for the food.

icyzE4KLUvI5AX47t_49qQ.text: My wife and I were in a hurry so we got some food to go. We got the zinger melt, Caesar salad and split osobucco. The zinger melt was amazing, garlic Parmesan! The salad was a salad and was good. The osobucco was good minus they forgot our sides. Service was also friendly and quick. Defin will be back and will check for my sides :-)

faGpHnuBvEiFAjsCagQKZw.text: They have some really great bar food and daily deals. I love love love their zingers especially dipped in blue cheese, and on Tuesdays zingers are only $5. Their zinger pizza is so delicious and it's only $8.49. Also their capt'n jack's buried treasure ice cream cake is such a satisfying dessert.

fCWE2BWrtV-1sczb_gKv4g.text: This place is nice, great diverse menu, diverse seating, affordable cocktails, an actual full bar. The food was great and the service was better. only had one dish sent back out of the many times I have visited and it was promptly taken care of, no fuss or a 1000 questions just a simple apology and then returned with the dish as ordered. I was very happy. When the bill came even though I didn't ask for anything to be taken off they removed my order from the bill. Another time I went me and my party was discussing ale and I had trouble remembering a particular one, our server asked me what I could remember about it and off of a vague description of an ale I never had there she was able to tell me what the name was, just a plus. great Mojitos by the way.   Would I come back yes I will, hope they don't change

x2wVvXxEYkWdGY5BkJmBqQ.text: Food is awesome and service is good!  I will definitely come back my next visit to Henderson!.  Went one day for lunch the blackened Cajun steak salad.  Went for dinner and had the 35 Shrimp Scampi that is one of the best I have ever had! Also has a nice drink and beer selection!

sGldd7fRtl4yVs6CWRW4PQ.text: Wednesday lobster specials are the best, especially for lunch when they aren't as busy and they throw in a salad!

8eV5zGDrjtfDJH1FkXNLfQ.text: We love this place, great place to go after a long hard day of work. Pua is the best, always taking care of friends and family!!!#zingernation

WVVAGRgHc4jQgtyGKC32SQ.text: Been here several timrs...this was a very bad experience today. Our waiter  CJ was great but when he made up for his error of not ordering our fries to begin with we still never got our fries. The manager did NOTHING to compensate the meal. Very poor of him considering he was himself serving fries to single ladies all around us. Very poor manager

CPAQsJNeifSEIckewC0bHQ.text: Great place and NO smoke. Nice menu with great daily special's. Parking is also good and atmosphere is good. Just a little bit on the pricey side for what they serve other than that the food is some what good

vFWQ6T5-CJ5IObKJeSTPWg.text: Great variety of food, tons of tv screens for games, excellent portions of food and a variety for whatever you're craving. Loved the friendly service, speediness, and spaciousness. Two beers and two salads and a fajita dinner to share was 34 bucks. Not bad!!! Would def go back!

VLZYMBDlqTbSRP1W76_B7g.text: We have eaten at Town Square location a few times and I always got the Fish-n-Chips. Eating here I of course had to have the same thing. Service was a little off but I will give it a pass due to opening week and new people being trained. We were seated immediately, it just opened. Drink orders were taken right away and I never had to ask for refills, they were on top of it. I got the fish n chips here to compare to the Town Square location. They of course were good and plentiful. My only complaint is that as our server got busy her attention to our table seemed to decrease. This location is somewhat bigger than the other in town one bar inside and a bar in an area that can be an indoor/outdoor area. Has a real comfortable fireplace area and many TV's for watching sporting events. Overall I will be going here as often as I can, great food fun atmosphere.

TxSiCTe9UymDa1hOobOZfg.text: Cold beer and good prices.  If you're looking to watch a game you can always find a tv.

vkERlrDDSumXpK7jWaC9kw.text: Have had fish and chips once before and they were good and not greasy,  but today the total opposite.  Took family there and very disappointed.  Don't know if we will do that again.

zJSGjPNs3NrVq2DhVW4jUA.text: We had a large group of 13, which is always a challenge.  The waitress tried hard, but there were a number of things working against her.  First the bartender must have given her the wrong beer for me.  Then it took an hour and twenty minutes for our food to arrive.  They were out of the signature salad dressing that people had ordered, and it took them that long to find out.  The waitress clearly recorded "no mushrooms" for someone else's order, but mushrooms arrived anyway.  The service staff was trying to make up for issues in the back, but overall we were unimpressed.

erjUWkKMdguTQGywxYTGdw.text: Love the happy hour.  Appetizers for just $5. Service is good and food was great. The chocolate cake will keep us coming back

HDYlVuHImz4mNJMKYhqXhA.text: Watch out!!!   My wife and I shared the seafood mac and cheese. Both of us got sick as dogs. I called and spoke with Jasmine who represented herself as the manager. While she said she was concerned she also told me she would have a senior manager call me right back. Three days later we're still waiting for that promised call so my question is how concerned are they really?  Nothing more than lip service!!!  So an unnamed manager responded to the post above asking for my contact information. Let's see----uh that's the same information you've had for nearly a week now that was given to Jazmine. More lip service and they still haven't fixed the rotten food BEWARE

wSTBxBBpJ6V5ee-jxkXJBw.text: Food is outstanding (although the size of the DINNER portion (not the "lunch portion") of the fish and chips varies greatly!)   Excellent burgers, fish and chips, daily specials...EXCEPT...  Miller's is trying to offer a Monte Cristo sandwich but they have no clue how to make it.  It should be ham, turkey, swiss on battered bread deep fried.  They get THAT part right.  But a traditional Monte Cristo also is sprinkled with powered sugar and served with something sweet to dip or spread such as maple pancake syrup or a jam/jelly such as strawberry.  They give you a bitter tasting raspberry mixture of something and the result is there is noting sweet about this sandwich.  I even contact their home office in the South but didn't even get the courtesy of a response.  We'll still go there once in a while because they have very good servers.  But they can write us off as Monte Cristo fans.

3rn8lEppf5SNuTFLyWG0kg.text: Terrible food. Great service nice server... blah blah blah. French onion soup was good onion rings . Burgers suck, nacho suck ...

J7uhpkIUW3XmrEQJQj56Pw.text: Went out here on a Wednesday night because I heard about the lobster special. Was able to get a flat iron steak and 1.25 lbs of lobster for about 24 bucks. Pretty good deal for good food.   I will say across the board my service was great from the door greeting to the waitress, to the manager who came by introduced himself and ask how everything was.   The food was good to. Not sure the steak was anything to brag about but it was good food. Really enjoyed the lobster, salad and baked potato. I can see myself indulging here again in the near future.

photos.caption: Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. Wednesday Special 16.99 Lobster 1.25 lbs.  Added a flat iron for 5 bucks more.

o7yiJcR5wHqxY2Sz0MRZPg.text: It's good to see new restaurants in Henderson along Stephanie Street, and judging by the packed parking lot a lot of people seem to like Miller's Ale House. I can't say that I'm a fan. I'll agree with Ashley B's review that it's better than Chili's and far better than suffering through Applebees, but it's really just a ho-hum nothing special chain restaurant with TV's plastered everywhere, and a boring menu of the same tired classics that can be easily prepared by a bunch of distracted teenagers working the kitchen.   If you're hungry and the parking lot is not jammed and you can't decide on what to eat at least you can shut your stomach up if you stop here. But if you want something different or original remember this is a chain....you won't find what you're craving here.   2 Stars...as in I was so underwhelmed by the place I almost fell asleep writing this one. Yawn!

v0SCbrNQ1JWceIlzd4w2Eg.text: We have been coming here as a group of about 7 or 8 about once a  week for a couple months. Usually have  a couple pitchers of beer as well as some appetizers  and a few  entrees.  We came in last Wednesday, was seated and when we tried to order our usual 2 pitchers of Stella Artois, was told that we can't get stella by the pitcher any longer. We could have other beers by the pitcher, but not stella.  So we ordered 4 large stella instead.  We were then told that we can't have it in the large size. We could,however , have other beers in the large size. Really? No explanation was given,  except " policy ".. Anyway, I'm sure they will get by without our $170 check every week, but it's too bad because we liked pretty much everything else. .

sXQafQRTLGeEji6q9NJyxg.text: Why it took me a year of living down the street from this amazing establishment to try it, I'll never know.  I mentioned it was my first time coming there the day I went and had some lunch alone.  I was treated like royalty!!  Had one of the BEST BOWLS OF CHILI I've ever had and a tasty margarita.  Brea (sp?) was my waitress and was so very friendly and helpful.  I will definitely return soon with my entire family and ask for her.  The menu is gorgeous with plenty of tasty options...spectacular and fun drink specials for every night.  And to top of off, the manager himself, Ron, came by my table thanking me for coming in and offered to send me home with one of their popular desserts for free!  The whole experience was exactly my definition of restaurant customer service PLUS amazing food.  Thats why I gave them 5 stars!  We will most certainly be back soon to try some ribs or a yummy prime rib steak!!

tS0uLx8MdMD7VcmvdbWWaA.text: They deserve zero stars Second time in two weeks just asking for a potato They say no problem and never have them Will never go back Food always cold It was twice in 2 weeks even after requesting if my food was available upfront Then to find out after order placed none available Told by manager she could accomodate me in 15 min I said ok then she comes back again saying sorry can not do that  Very poor communication between kitchen and servers Will never go back

oaxLzVEioHuODrWX8jfiNw.text: Me and my girl come here 3-4 times a month that.The food is made with quality ingredients and great prices.We like Brandon as our server,he's very personable and always gets out order right.We like the atmosphere and the staff is very attentive.

e6JFY9mxiFO6TfS5drHu-w.text: My husband talked me in to going again and I'm glad I gave in.  Much better food and service the last few times we went.  I always get the Phili-Cheesesteak and I add jalapeno's.  Drink specials are good and ambiance is fun.  Very kid friendly.

Dvibzg00BxJHkAx6Qgl-Dg.text: The first few times I was there, it was pretty good. Today, it was disgusting.  I had a Zinger salad and it was awful.  Dried up greens, some pieces of chopped up tomatoes and the Zingers were dry too. I have NO desire to go back. I got the feeling that now that they have been there for a while, they dont need to make the effort anymore.  There are way too many places to go. No one should have to tolerate a less than acceptable meal.

n4CbSF13AKpIQ3NzGD2uAQ.text: I'll give this place two stars, no I won't. Prices are  low also mean poor food quality!!! Steak fajitas were small. Plenty of vegetables but almost NO steak! Server wasn't very sure of questions we had. We were first timers here and probably last timers... Free dessert for our first visit which was good since we didn't eat much and that wasn't very good!!!

cpPAZRI7wRbdqHr0tX8xHA.text: My friend and I just stopped in for a quick app and a beer.  The bar maid was very friendly and the food an beer were excellent.  The best part was that we didn't smell like smoke when we left.  I would definitely return.

BKf6ZafAK-r8hql-OlcHnA.text: Loved the food and our server jaclyn was awesome!! She's so sweet and great with the kids! My son said he wants to eat dinner here with jaclyn every night lol! Will definitely be back!

tYjQocyWXA7OWJDHhXXm_A.text: This place is horrible. The food truly sucks. No matter how many chances we give them. How can they be So bad. And yet the Town Square location is great. Don't waste your time or money on this place.

0IZ0oo3yy6p-y-pWgwR9QQ.text: Place is huge. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable. No gambling (which is fantastic!)!  Food was good but presented a bit dishoveled. Portion was a bit undersized.   Happy Hour specials were decent.   Over all a fair value.

Mli4RLaXZTPQ-SUw0Q_umQ.text: Went on Saturday.  They were busy and we waited approx 20 minutes to get in.    Food always consistent and good.  Had the teriyaki zingers.  And jambalaya for first time.   Very good.     Only thing wrong were drinks took forever.  Came way after our meal did.   This was still after server and buster were aware.  I am still giving good marks because of how great the mgr handled it.  Server informed him and he came right over.  Apologized. He then comped the drinks.   Before we left , he thanked us again for eating there, being patient and apologized again.  Nice and professional.   We will definitely be back As a side note - make sure you sign up for their emails.  You get a birthday offer which is great and they give you more than your actual birthday to use it.

RgicfB19cKIqPubYVyV82w.text: In a nutshell: Basic food you can eat while watching the game on one of the many TVs. Food won't blow you away, but it isn't in any way a "bad" place to eat. Happening atmosphere, lots of tvs, lots of beers on tap.  No complaints about food. Service was acceptable. Check delivered at appropriate time, returned a little later than I'd like. Friendly staff, somewhat attentive service. Seated party of 4 right away. Nice spacious clean booth. Fun, happy, buzzing environment. Spacious and clean.  Would return with buddies to watch game and hang. Wouldn't go out of my way to return for food or to take a date.

UQLZWHg8TIxfaSM29vf8Yw.text: First time here and it was amazing! Delicious food, great service, our waiter was really nice. The atmosphere was great, we were able to watch the cowboys vs redskins game. We stayed as long as we wanted. (Until the game was over Lol). Which was nice because we don't get out much with our newborn.  The zingers are juicy, sweet, and beyond extravagant! A must have for sure!!

cbdrREhwhxG5oKyKr3qf_A.text: Waited 10 mins at the bar before being helped, took a phone call and as soon as I did the bartender was in my face talking to me to place my order, completely rude.  I came for the prime rib special, so I muted my phone to take the order to find out they are out.  I ordered the next thing I saw on the menu and was told they stop serving that at 6.  The only thing worse then coming here tonight would be nothing. Well done miller ale house.

9jiaA_I7QwV9yJHN4BFkWA.text: Absolutely the slowest service ever. We made a reservation for 25 people in advance so ensure that they were prepared for a big group to come in. We had a group of soccer girls and their families, so when we arrived, they took our orders based on jersey numbers. However, it took an hour and a half for food to start coming out. Drinks were never refilled, orders were sporadically brought to the tables. It also didn't make sense that the burger orders came out way before the salad orders and that the LAST person to order had their food come out first. Even a simple order of fries took an hour to come out. It came to the point of having to cancel orders because the team was on a tight schedule and we had to get back on the road.   The restaurant should've also given our 4 tables at least 2 waiters. However, while complaining, we made sure that the waitress knew that it wasn't in her control on how the kitchen controlled their food orders and what they prioritized to come out first. Even so, the restaurant was under staffed and had poorly managed our group. It didn't help that once the food came out, sauces were missing and burgers were way overdone.   Lastly, they are known for their ZINGERS. But how did their most well known item come out LAST. LAST. After an hour and a half.

HOe82I5d0AIe2pcP9eobsw.text: Decent burger with fries and a side of cheese  They even walk around and make balloon animals for the kids.

bPc7EtHuSY83xdAfAE-4_A.text: Had been here several years ago when we were visiting and don't remember liking it. Tried it again last night and was pleasantly surprised, great service, good selection of food and decent prices. Hubby got the flat iron steak and boom boom shrimp. Pretty good steak and cooked a perfect medium rare. I had the 35 fried shrimp and fries, couldn't eat it all, but what I did eat was tasty and promptly received our to go box when requested. Will be coming back.

BpL434iy2jUuvpn3NFhkig.text: Good food at a good price. This is a fun sports bar and restaurant that has all the games. The food is good and the ambiance is "fun." This is a simple place that does things right with a great atmosphere. The zingers are an excellent choice if you want to eat light and have a drink with some friends like I do all the time. Millers has become our regular hangout. Come and join us.

MvkVpP8qtUMaxTwp8aICQA.text: We had a five year renewal celebration with about 20 people attending planned in February at another big chain restaurant. About a week before the event, I called to add more people to the reservation but the venue couldn't accommodate.  So, I was stuck. I took a breath and said a prayer and then quickly thought of a good restaurant with clean restrooms and tasty food with decent prices and Miller's came right to mind.  I called Miller's and the manager was SO kind and helpful. They had no problem at all with the date, the amount of people or the various split checks.  We had absolutely no issues at all, and we were able to hold our special celebration in class and style. The food was fantastic, service was excellent, tables were clean and set up for us nicely. We were able to bring in a cake and favors and decorate. We had a lovely celebration and we highly recommend Miller's for anyone's special occasion!  We are forever grateful to Miller's for coming to our rescue! Thank you all!

UTSqJRz5dUJvKbGkWSXrxA.text: Local, local, local kick it spot! It was cool to watch the place fill up during the 2ish hours we were there drinking!   My friends' and I came in expecting a Happy Hour drink sesh, but instead of Happy Hour specials, they have specific "day" specials. So for today there was a Friday tab with drink specials. I had a double Jameson/Diet Coke for $8, not bad compared to the strip.  They had some shots specials for only $5, dude that's a bargain.   As far as food, they had $5.99 specials, $6.99 specials which includes pastas, sandwiches, salads and more! The menu is pretty large with a ton of options.   We opted to sit on one of the large long tables with bar top stools. The restaurant itself is pretty clean and open.   Service? We had Lisa as our server; although super sweet- I do wish she would have checked in on us a little bit more. In the beginning we experienced a wait with out initial drink order- and didn't understand why, since there was no one sitting up at the bar. Whatever.   Miller's Ale House seems like a cool kick it spot to kick back a few drinks- as far the food, it's basic.

vBoddtJQG-j2BKQDMKiOnQ.text: First time dining here. Ordered the Tito's martini and it was tasty but it was a half filled. Only because I had the three olives in it. So i asked if that is the way it was always served? Ordered another and got a full glass this time but before I even took a sip I knew it was watered down. Pretty disappointed that a bartender who has zero pride in her job would serve a cocktail like that. I guess making it right isn't the policy. Just a simple honesty that those are the company measurement standards would have been better. She shouldn't be a bartender, she doesn't deserve the title! Just like cooking, bartending is an Art only for the talented. If you need a good bartender I can recommend one who won't be an embarrassment.

7olh7pnBkxtNBmH8fHg5FQ.text: One of the very few sports bars I frequent, as I don't watch anything but MMA and some baseball.   Service: Imho, top notch. Every time we come here, they're PACKED, yet go out of their way to find us a couple seats. You might end up sitting with some strangers, but who cares unless you're a crabby douche bag.   Food/Drinks: Drinks are priced well and taste strong if you ask nicely. They're NORMAL prices on drinks are about the same as PT's Happy Hour prices. Food is good, but not great. I've had everything from their salads, quesadilla, to their chicken "fingers." It's good bar food, but I'm from Wisconsin where almost all places have amazing bar food.. Did someone say Beer battered 3-Cheese curds? Haha  Would give 4.5 stars... But to get 5 with me, you gotta "WOW" me. I'm picky, so 4 stars for the overall experience. Will change to 5, if the experience keeps up..

photos.caption: Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. Always a blast here, watching UFC&#39;s with random people. Fun place.

QUw5oNsljkZCGNJMWhipdA.text: Wanted to update my review... went last night for dinner (5:30) with friends. They asked for a specific waitress so we sat in her section. I don't know if it's because she knew them, but she wasn't very attentive to us.  When she did come by it was rushed.  When our food was delivered, the salad had no dressing, we asked for that, extra ranch and some mayo. I don't know where the girl went to get those condiments that she did not come back for 15 minutes. Prior to that our waitress came back and we told her we were waiting on everything, she went and got it and brought it back. The food was great!  Everyone was satisfied. I would definitely go back but would want a different waitress.

5cF31z9kX6IAnfdFQKTY4w.text: For was really good but service was extremely slow. Came in for my birthday dinner and waited a good hour and 15 minutes before our food came. It really wasn't busy so I'm not sure why. Had to remind the server several times that we asked for sauces and boxes. My Tito's lemonade didn't taste like there was anything but lemonade and strawberry syrup in it. Enjoyed dinner just didn't expect to spend almost 3 hours in the restaurant on my birthday.

09dxmjuwMwXS09e408BNZw.text: Super slow service! We waited for an hour and a half before getting our food which quite honestly isn't even that good given the length of time we waited. We asked for a meal boxed and to-go since we had someone waiting for their food at home, but by the time they brought it out, it was plated and we had to wait another 20 minutes for a box! To top it off, we just wanted to leave as we were very disappointed in the staffing and food, and we had to wait 40 minutes for our check which we needed to ask for twice before it was brought out to us!   There were also waiters standing around the kitchen while there was very clearly work to be done... once the check was finally brought out, there was some clear mistakes and there were items missing from our tab... we should've just left.

FQnQTYwm9gL1BEsTQGB1GA.text: I always passed by this place but never looked into it until I looked at the menu online and saw their happy hour deals! Came here on a Friday afternoon around 3 PM. Their happy hour is from 3-6 PM and they also have a late night one. My friend and I sat at the bar and ordered a few drinks and some food.   The drinks are ridiculously cheap during happy hour! You could get a pitcher of sangria, beer, Long Island, or mojito for about $10! They also have a lot of beers on tap and even have fireball on tap which was such an interesting thing to see. I ordered a side of fries and the nachos which were unbelievably ENORMOUS. They weren't lying on the menu when they wrote "enormous". I should have believed them! My tab ended up being less than $50 for the amount that I drank which was not bad at all.  I thought I had more pictures but I guess I did not save them off of my Snapchat!  I can't wait to come back for more happy hours! They offer different deals everyday!

photos.caption: Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. Irish car bomb!!

6PeEXDa5c8393f2b5oN-8w.text: Great selection of beers, good food, and they show the ppv UFC fights. This is one of my new favorite spots to get a beer and bite to eat. All the servers I've had so far were very polite and professional. Also, my 3 year old daughter loves their zingers(chicken strips).

PoYqmaRS46AhENkHA7SiMA.text: I myself and a friend came here to Miller's ale House in Henderson and had one of the best meals all around. The cook gets five stars for the preparation of my steak and seafood. Our server, Bobbie Jo, is so awesome, polite and on point with our order. I wish I could take her with me to every dining establishment I visit. My friend was disappointed due to there were no male servers on shift (lol). I will be back again! Thank you Miller's Ale House.....

qxilIbHojl5feKhluLE_5A.text: Nichole is the best bartender this restaurant has. She makes you feel right at home. Her service is amazing! Thank you Nichole!

DHtLO3unqt6bphT9oG5sLw.text: The food excellent and the staff great.  Bradley D was so great, wonderful customer service!

qvwOlwovxcDEdaPN5NIeAA.text: I had an amazing nachos! Excellent food and service at Millers Ale House.   Highly recommend it!

BFVcHZPwnQiD9jYnpfSNhg.text: Good beer..and drinks great place to watch the games good food... they usually get the UFC for free as well, however get there early!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. Let&#39;s get this party started!!

AHPhRQgQeTjrkuaoPRobIw.text: Came to visit my auntie from Cali. For dinner we came here and the food was great along with their customer service. Cortae is awesome. Great bartender!!! Cheers!

ENXILVzSf5waDbJuYNeoBg.text: Went to this place last night to celebrate my daughters 16th birthday. We ordered kids hot dog and burger and my daughter and hubby had burgers. Their food was ok. I ordered a Caesars Salad with grilled chicken. My salad came out and the first thing I always do is check my salad. So someone preparing my salad in the kitchen put all the nasty lettuce that normally belong in the trash on the plate and covert it with better lettuce so you can't spot it straight. Sure I don't eat that trash. So I asked for a manager. She comes, takes it and has another one done. Guess what that was as bad as the 1st one. After that I was not hungry anymore. I gave you a chance to fix it one time and then I get he same trash on my plate. I will not eat at this place again. If you can't make the effort to serve good quality food, I will not pay a dime to have anything else ever again.

XmBQ_yIl9WNpB5fzRP7MjA.text: This Sports Bar was recommended by a friend.   78 flat screen TV's, food was great, reasonably  priced, large drink menu just something for everyone's taste.    Two things that were great was the cleanliness of the entire place!   One of the managers stopped by our table and he said they hire an outside cleaning crew to come in daily.  It really shows.    Second was our server Anntoniette she was just a joy!  She was full of personality and made us fell welcomed.   Only bad part was our team was creamed by a bunch of crazy ducks!

9hKIXulPDCwwyByAcxu4gg.text: I love Miller's ale House. Excellent food with excellent prices. The staff is very friendly. The restaurant is very clean. Where else can you go and get 35 shrimp for $13 And I think on Tuesday nights it's less than that. This has become a regular place for my family. If you are looking for a great atmosphere and great food look no further.

Bc_PKxTo-iXN6NCDVuKBNA.text: We always come here for the UFC fights.  We have never ordered any of the plates off the menu. We always order off of the appetizer menu. Never had anything that wasn't good. They have excellent views of all the TV's to watch any sport or fight.  And a long list of beers.

6FzCEU0zddQ8909FYAi8Fw.text: We've been here several times & have never been disappointed. Great kids menu, wings & salads. The HUGE selection of national brand & local craft beers on tap is phenomenal. If you're a sports junkie, they are probably showing your team on one of their several TV's. They also show UFC fights here, but it's gonna be crowded & you'll share a table w/complete strangers.

xRjUjhiasu-IZlr5vxhqKw.text: Our favor weekday night place, great atmosphere, Brandon the server is always very nice and helpful. The food is always fresh and delicious.

27pOSUObUvRGslBLO8JWNQ.text: I can't say I'm really impressed with this place. I came in at about 10:30 PM on a Tuesday night and sat at the bar since they offer happy hour from 10 PM to 12 AM. They offer $5 appetizers and drinks between $2-$6.   There was about 15 people at the bar, give or take a couple, and one bartender. She seemed to manage pretty well, didn't look flustered and still gave good service.   I ordered a Green Flash IPA (per bartender's recommendation) and an order of Miller's loaded fries (1 pound of fries topped with 2 cheeses, chopped onions and crispy bacon, comes with a side of ranch).   The beer was excellent, I would definitely order another one. The fries, on the other hand, were extremely stale and seemed like they were sitting for too long. The melted cheese became stiff and chewy shortly after receiving the appetizer and the fries were cold. Definitely a sub-par, disappointing snack. Overall, an average experience.   I would return for the good prices and great beer selection, but I would think twice about the food.

H2ZlYzmx7eUC3yZRL2SPGA.text: Patio bar is now open everyday. Great place to hang out watch a game and have a few cold ones. Food is good and service is great. Love Dani, Timi, Courtney, most all the bartenders are friendly and always available. Come check it out.

kcD1HJ-Gos1KMY7SIgyEMg.text: Miller's Ale house was the best food I have ever eaten in Nevada. The steak came out perfect, the ribs were amazing! The atmosphere was great. We are still raving about it and will definitely eat there again when we visit Henderson!

G_GciP400ZbNXuQUV3xrQQ.text: Food was amazing as always. The bartender, named Nathan, was somewhat slow with bringing the drinks over each time. I'll be back, but expect a better level of customer service.

oQMQ1utuK2qFkaoGcScIaA.text: I come here all the time for lunch my business is right down the street so it's pretty convenient. The place is huge so even if it is busy there is plenty of seating available.   Kudos to the management for always having plenty of staff on hand to handle when it gets busy!   The menu has pretty much anything and everything you would want and the Zingers are my favorite. Staff is always super friendly and efficient and it's always squeaky clean inside!

9Ywb6trPWt6tUorsLpZdVg.text: First time here, & it was just ok. Wasn't too crazy about the food, but service was good. Drinks were okay too. Nothing special about this place, and probably won't go again.

TtQbqsmpwnKdx2JTjv1_Kw.text: The worst meal we have had in years.  Went to lunch at about 1:30 PM.  Food service was very slow.  Appetizer took a long time, food took a long time and the beers took so long that I cancelled the second one.  The food was horrible.  My wife had the build your own chicken sandwich.  There are three add ons to the sandwich.  It came with two.  The bun tasted like it had been frozen and defrosted for the meal.  The bacon was overcooked and tasteless.  I had the fish and chips (a lunch special).  I got two scraggly looking pieces of fish and another that could only have been a piece of tail.  It was 1/4 on an inch thick including the breading.  That left something like 1/32 of an inch of fish.  The other two pieces were just very small.  The french fries were soggy and tasted like they had been made hours ago and re-heated in the microwave.  Soft on the outside and soggy on the inside.  For this feast of a meal, we were charged $28.00.  That was for the sandwich, the fish and one beer. (plus tax).  If I go there again, shame on me!!

7mIhwbKr-eFHZZbpc6MpIQ.text: I met my family here on a Sunday afternoon while they were watching football (about 10+ of us).  While I did come a little late, it took quite awhile to get someone over to our area and by that time everyone had already finished up eating so I just got a water.  It's cool that they have multiple football games going on and the prices aren't too bad - you can get out of there with only spending $10-$15 if you want to be frugal.  There's also parking behind the place.  That's also the only way to get in since there's no driveway directly to the restaurant from the street - you have to use the turn-in then turn right and right again into their parking.  I prefer the one in Town Square.

cnCxo0kC2H4bpJdZjZB7NA.text: We just felt like going where there's good food "and no little noisy kids" ...we love little kids but just sometimes we just like grown up atmosphere....so, Miller's Ale House seemed perfect. We selected to sit at the tall table area and Brandon was our very attentive wait person. The area had a few tables with customers, but, yes, a high chair with a cheery, verbal toddler.  :::inhaled::: We selected the very delicious Philly French Dip---perfectly done---and the Mahi Mahi grilled fish sandwich---delicious and yummy!!  Brandon wasn't hovering, he was exactly as should be: offering when needed.  The cheerful toddler blended in without any complaints from me---yes, I would have rolled my eyes or asked for a different table---, ice tea was refreshing and we left feeling very relaxed, full from the great lunch and saying "Yes, we will return (and recommend)". Thank you, Miller's Ale House! (Sorry for no pictures, but it was clean and very ambiancy for us!)

W4opjEMFREjWd3J7M77-RQ.text: Great place, great service even being packed with the Mayweather/McGregor fight, Timi is the best.

DQwSJ6CSmRZqq_bF5zxrzw.text: We came here to watch the Mayweather/McGregor fight and this place was packed. We still had the best service from Timi. She had like 50 people she was in charge of but she still had a smile on her face and kept the great service coming. She was a GREAT bartender and my girlfriend and I will definitely be back. If i owned a bar/ restaurant I would want a bartender like her.

WzTnukY5gxWm8VRXLIWXwQ.text: Lisa was a great server. Very attentive, food came out quickly and correctly She had a great personality and invited us to return

wqSWEPwotmpmGHDJSIki8g.text: I've always like Miller's for good food and a good environment which is why I stopped in late tonight (Sunday) for a late dinner and a few drinks.   I was greeting by Zyze when I sat at the bar and right away she brought over the drink and food menu and offered a water while I decided what to order. She quickly circled back to see if I'd made up my mind and I ordered a captain and coke. I took a few minutes to look over the menu but sure enough she came back within a few minutes to see if I was ready, her timing was great the entire night.   I went for the ribeye as I was craving a good steak and man, did the kitchen deliver. The steak was cooked perfectly, which Zyze asked me to cut into to confirm as soon as I received it (always nice to know staff is attentive to food quality!)  The veggies were steamed well, the mash was great and the steak itself with the slab of butter on top was just what I was craving.   I essentially wrote this review though because of the service. Being a Sunday night, it wasn't very busy but people started trickling in as I was halfway through my meal and Zyze didn't skip a beat, she kept checking in every so often and stopped by when she saw my drink a little low.   Management was around and aware to help when a few tables stopped in and they were visibly available to help whenever needed. Having previously been a bartender, that attention makes a difference in the way the night runs for the employees and for guests.   Overall, I was looking for a chill environment, great food and good drinks and Zyze and Miller's delivered.   Oh, and Sunday late happy hour starts at 10! Awesome!

9HpXHgHR5pH1YFbkz3aT_g.text: Went for a beer and chicken wings last nite  , first time in this place and the Last One !! The worst wings I tried ,  Still 100 % with Sierra Gold

XI2XgD2HgptKKhy7FbRUhA.text: My husband and I stopped in for lunch on a Sunday afternoon. It was our first visit to this establishment. It definitely won't be our last either. Miller's Ale House is a excellent choice for dining. The restaurant is clean and tidy. Our waitress was friendly and attentive, efficient and kind. She checked on us often.  After we were seated in a comfortable and roomy booth, we noticed the menus were already on the table near the condiments. Upon perusing the menu, I ordered an iced tea, my husband ordered ice water for our beverages. Next, he ordered a classic cheeseburger with fries and I ordered fish and chips, four generous sizes of cod deep fried in Samuel Adams Beer Batter. It came with nice, thick cut fries, tartar sauce and coleslaw.  Our food arrived soon after ordering it. It was cooked and prepared perfect. Every bite delicious. My husband's burger was grilled perfectly the way he likes it-medium well. My fish was not greasy but crispy, the way I like it. The fries were excellent as was the coleslaw--which was mild and tasty.  We read people's comments on Yelp last night before coming here today. I think this might be our favorite place to come from now on.  I recommend Miller's Ale House for anyone seeking a nice place to relax and watch sports. They offer a lot of televisions so wherever you sit, you will have a good viewing experience.

hwnouccbd6br9XmE44F9Gw.text: So, today my dad came home and asked me to figure out which restaurant we were gonna go to for my moms birthday so I searched for a bit and found this place and I looked through the photos and the menus and she wanted lobster tails and they have them so I thought it would be perfect. I kept looking and scrolling through all the photos on here and the more I kept looking the more interested I was and I was basically set on the fact that we were going here.  We just left and as soon as I walked in I knew it was going to be a place we would be attending more often. Everyone sat down and we were all excited and all of the staff was so nice and greeted us nicely which is always appreciated!  All of us ordered our food and the wait wasn't long AT ALL. It felt so fast and everyone knows how impatient we all get waiting on your food to come is...  All of our food looked SO good and of course it tasted so so yummy, too. I got something I wouldn't have normally ordered and I was ehhh about it at first but oh my goodness it was so so flavorful and filling. I will most definitely come back and recommend it to others.

photos.caption: Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. Hickory Chicken Sandwich

2vkcqxLP2sOa2mEKkLAuGg.text: After a long time of back and forth as to if we would try this place, we did. Pretty big dining area, move large parking lot around several other businesses. Their beer selection is average, nothing too fancy.   Our waitress was the best part about the dining experience. I believe her name was Zyze (?, long blonde hair) super, super sweet and helpful. We ran her ragged and she never dropped her smile off of her face.   We ordered the Asian salad, veggie burger, bacon burger, and the chicken salad. The burgers were both really good actually, the salads were pretty sub par. I ordered a Painkiller and it was too sweet.   It was such a relaxed environment though and that's why I enjoyed he experience. That and our super sweet server!! We will be back for lunch sometime... won't be ordering mixed drinks from the bar though, not worth the money!!

m-ogXTNyHpYjbY6SLznZww.text: Graveyard here!!!   Fun back bar is closed and the tall boy tables have been moved out.  Food is under cooked.  What happened to this place?  Will not be our football central this fall.

Hb9SeSwneXroejSNybg7ag.text: My husband and I have been coming to Miller's since they opened.  We have watched a slow decline in food quality over the years.  We tried to give it another shot last night, only to find that the back bar(best thing about the place) was chained off and closed. I am hopeful that this is temporary but if not I guess we will be seeking a new football central this year.

UH34ttsTe3jhXXJh9TWxEg.text: The food here is just.. not very good.  I have come and tried it time and time again and this time will most likely be my last. There are pluses and minuses but there's not enough to keep me coming for more.   I only took a shot of the "French onion soup" because in all seriousness.. where is the soup? I understand that the bread soaks up some liquid, but this was just BAD. Granted that they offered to give me another it just wasn't that good to begin with.

photos.caption: Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. Where&#39;s the soup?!

Ebv6P2O_LjOiFmMXUAvb6w.text: My family and I come to this location a few times a month and are always extremely pleased with the service.  The staff is attentive and always seems to genuinely care about our experience.  We have had the pleasure of being served by Melissa and Brad multiple times and each time they have taken the time to chat with our children and make us feel like they enjoy our presence.  We have even give  Melissa the nickname "Zingers" which always gets a laugh and makes us smile!

JAwbxxTNeEe9wlHec0BUmQ.text: Well this place just sucks in all sorts of ways...  Gotta lead off with my favorite part....  i ordered ribs which came out overcooked and super dry with almost no BBQ sauce.  I'm normally not one to complain so I asked if they could bring some extra BBQ sauce so hopefully i could still choke them down.  It was rough but i survived.  My wife ordered Pork Osso Buco which is supposed to come with gravy and there was barely a trace of gravy on the plate so she asked for a side of gravy as well.  One of the waitresses brought 2 sides and said one was BBQ sauce and one was gravy and ran off.   They looked identical so we tasted both to determine that they were both BBQ sauce so we let her know that neither was gravy.   She quickly brought the gravy.... but this is the best part....  SHE ASKED IF SHE COULD HAVE 1 OF THE SIDES OF BBQ BACK??!!     I was caught off guard by the request...  pretty sure i gave a nice blank stare as i tried to process the request... i mean... was she going to take it back and use it again??  Why would you even think to ask for a tiny little cup of BBQ sauce back??  I had so many questions...  I told her that we both tasted them to see what they were....  so i wouldn't suggest taking it back... but that totally grosses me out that there is a possibility that they would re-use a mistake like that.  I began to wonder if perhaps they would reuse any uneaten ribs or fries that i didn't finish....  And sadly based on the lack of sauce and gravy and a few other things.... i don't doubt that they actually do cut corners like that.  (Ok...  not the ribs and fries....  but the sauce...  i really believe they were going to take it back to reuse)  Other highlights include....  Super watered down alcoholic drink that we tried to exchange only to be lectured that they put the exact same amount of ingredients in every mixed drink... so i guess they couldn't possibly make a mistake or perhaps every other customer is fine with super water downed drinks.  It was bad...  Switched to Long Island Iced Tea and that recipe is clearly off too....  but wasn't as bad so stuck with that.    Secondary waitress (the one that asked for the BBQ sauce back) gave us attitude the rest of the night and they all seemed to avoid us from that point on.   Had to flag them down for refills.    Fries were soggy and not very good.  Ordered a side of Ranch that they forgot...  not a big deal... just throwing that out there since so many other problems.  Table next to us overheard some of the stuff going on and joined in on the joking about what a terrible experience we all were having.  I mean what can u do really?  Tried to make the most of it.  Not a fan at all....  unlikely I will be back and will do my best to talk people out of wanting to meet there again.  Yikes!

l7L5jd9fHG5xrqBr-XcVQg.text: Happy Hour Mon-Fri 11-7 and Sun-Thur 10-Close  Happy Hour specials vary by day but are usually $2-$7 drink specials and $5 select appetizers.  OMG!  The drinks here are so cheap!  Like $5-$7 for a drink.  Those are the regular prices.  Not happy hour.  Happy hour is even cheaper.  I am used to at least $12 bucks a drink so was shocked by these prices.  The drinks taste great too.  The bartenders are always super friendly.  Tons of TV's to catch a game.  I will definitely be coming back.    They also have daily lunch/dinner specials and a kids eat free night.

D-UDJ0eI4spMikL2OFX4Ow.text: Been here a few times now and every time the food is pretty good and customer service is always great! The chicken nachos are my favorite, and it's so much that you can share with 4 people. The best dessert ever, if you're a chocolate addict like me will be their Captain Jack dessert!!! OMG! It will leave your mouth watering! If you love chocolate like I do, I promise you will not regret it! SO DELICIOUS!

6vuwWUFXZn3_M6MAkJtuvA.text: I drive by this place weekly and not sure why I never stopped but I have been missing out.   I got the Cue Bacon Cheeseburger medium well and it came out PERFECTLY!   Service was great, it was 10:30pm on a Thursday and it was dead. Lots of TVs within easy view of every seat that I could tell.   Only negative I have is about the fries. They really had potential and I really wanted to love them but, they were not fresh. I'm not sure if it was because we were there late or what but they came out as if they had been made a few hours ago and just sitting under a warmer. This isn't a deterrent for me to not go back because I definitely plan on giving this place another shot since I love fries, that burger was great and the server was very friendly and attentive.

FHSilgjbAquP_JQSUdpDaA.text: Chicken philly is amazing! They are really stingy with French fries. Would give 5 stars except waitress had a bad attitude!

CzVRqkQOR1HMIGCJ0SgjiA.text: While visiting the Las Vegas area, I stopped into Miller's Ale House and it was such a great experience. Colby (behind the bar) was friendly and professional and served some of the best drinks we have had. Thank you for providing such a great experience while we were in Las Vegas. Definitely will be coming back.

6j7pLFTG_U-guybrXSBBAw.text: Miller's Ale House is a great place for lunch or dinner.  They have a menu with both healthy and not so healthy but rather tasty appetizers and meals.  They are also able to make changes to many of the items or substitute sides.  They have lots of TVs to catch a game, and the noise level is always pretty average, so it's a good place to even have a meeting.  The restaurant is always clean, and the service is consistently good!  They also serve Pepsi product, so you can get your Mt. Dew fix here!

yzqnwb5HLU9VcPWp6olR8g.text: Great food! Paul at the bar is great! The service was great! I will definitely be coming back the next time I am in Henderson!
