5SG6bb8yJ-CTN7G66Z0C4A.text: I & my boyfriend went here a couple times. We love the food here. Atmosphere is awesome. The waiter we had today, Paul has a awesome personality and is a fantastic waiter. We will be back here again!(:

NDI8yIMCHWcPi0L3YAjCyA.text: Millers Ale House earns 5 stars.  Food is excellent, staff is excellent, our waitress Tara explained everything and a was there whenever we needed something.  We even took food to go because it was so good.  We also loved the decor, 5 stars to whoever designed this place.  We are definitely going back, glad they are here in Henderson.

oaqApz590Q9fXNzEBXCQHw.text: I came here with some family friends. I ordered the half rack baby back ribs with rice, a side of tossed salad, and a raspberry iced tea. First off, the drinks they serve here are HUGE..or should i say the cups they put them in are huge and they fill them pretty well. 2 people could share one drink easily. The ribs were ok with a generic bbq sauce and the rice was like a pilaf that was microwaved. The tossed salad was...err....salad. So why am i giving this place 3 stars you might ask? Well, i have to admit that the ambience is great. There are so many widescreen tvs (probably more than Best Buy)  that you can literally sit anywhere and have ur eyes directed at the game without turning your neck. The place is pretty clean and the employees wear football jerseys. If I were in the mood to watch my favorite game and have some pupus (i mean appetizers) on the side, Miller's Ale house would be a great place to go with friends.

xdcPKsOZ4MCP-XpDc6MirA.text: Pretty good. I like their daily deaks on food and drinks. Usually come here witb friends after an exam for drinks. Good service

ETY8to_a7kQLaMAVjUf-EQ.text: I come here to watch the World Cup games. Excellent food with decent prices and specials. The beers selection is limited but still good. And there're plenty of TV's to have a decent view of the games. My favorite bartender is Cindy, she is so cute

vbxS1dOhYvovWcEvhd5u_A.text: I had my Graduation party here with friends and family. Everyone was so friendly and the food was awesome. The Calamari was the best I've ever had. Great times and Great food what more can a girl ask for. You have a fan for life!

AYnCP9Tq3KkgbmdsttAVBw.text: We went for lunch. I had the taco salad. The old saying " where's the beef" came to mind. It might have had a tablespoon if that much. It would have been good with more meat in it. The meatball sub was good. The beers were very reasonably priced. It had a good atmosphere with a pleasant staff. The service was good. My husband has had the meatloaf on the Thursday special and really liked it. I will go there again but will probably not order the Taco Salad.

helG4-iqvYwVAeShaaWbxA.text: I was highly dissatisfied with this locations customer service and the food. Firstly, it took our server between 20-30 minutes to address our table and the food took 40 minutes and up to be prepared and brought to our table. It was quite frustrating because my friend and I were extremely hungry. Our server was nice and apologetic but it didn't make up for the bad tasting food and incorrect items we were served. My "steamed" broccoli was crunchy and cold while my friends raw broccoli was warm. I received the wrong side dish and both our steaks were overcooked. The steak was lacking in flavor so much that we tried every sauce and it still tasted bland. When it came time to pay the bill, I wanted to speak to the manager because we weren't able to eat our food and certainly were not going to pay for something we couldn't eat. The manager gave us a discount but, did not comp the meal. Most restaurants will comp the customers meal if they couldn't eat the meal due to the taste. I shouldn't have to pay for disgusting food. We were also charged double for one drink. I was so frustrated at that point that I just left. The food was absolutely inedible and I will not be returning.

I42NykNOeco-1QNm8XUKdg.text: Never been here but will and it is funny that people are that stupid to believe this is fine dinning what it is a big bar food upscale if you don't want stuff cooked in grease then stay away really reality check.

7ndcbqlIdyX3gf-qxBCqCw.text: Since this location has opened there has been quite a variation in the happy hour menu and the beer selection during happy hour. Their drink menu previously stated select CRAFT beers were five dollars; at times they were even posted on the black board. Then they limited the selection of appetizers to a few selections. Yesterday we went in to have a craft beer and our intention was to purchase gift cards for gifts. We were informed that the happy hour is between 10pm-12pm...no more happy hour during the normal times. We asked the price of the craft beers and they ran between 6.95 and 8.95; well I can go to a local taproom, Sierra Gold, Guiseppe's, and other places and get a good beer for 5.00. I asked to talk to the manager and he came over quickly; and told the same about the happy hour. He wasn't quite rude but he definitely did not care about our thoughts, he disagreed with me that the craft beers used to be posted. Well, I didn't buy any gift cards and we went to Sierra Gold for our beer, I know now why the bar was empty.

CPFWHOKw6OlOf8wLWry75A.text: No stars... Absolutely terrible management. Tonight was approximately the 10th time I have came all way over to millers just to have the doors locked much much earlier then their closing time. I have grown very tired of it. Enough to write my first ever yelp review. Usually screw up whatever I order. Last time they finally got it correct only problem then was they brought my entree, then my appetizer, and finally after that my salad. I have been here many times. Turnover rate for employees is like nothing I ever seen anywhere else before. Handful of employees are great  but they don't stick around there very long.

tz_bNlFqj7_zwePgCk6AWQ.text: As first timers we were optimistic that this would be better than the average reviews however that was not the case. While wait staff was friendly - she attempted to give us the next tables drinks . Our food came out quickly - my husband had the special And I had a salad however it came in the middle of our appetizer ( chips and quac which was tasty) . Portions were less than we thought for the price and the environment is like every other sports bar- giving three stars for an average experience - however with so many choices in town we won't go back.

NFXcz5W7bcWBfoSb9YQzww.text: Came to this place cuz of yelp reviews. The restaurant is open in a cafeteria style feel with a lack of imagination for theme by plastering variaties of fish replicas throughout their walls. Seating is in a manner of everyone is in your business even up to five tables away. I know this because the chocolate cake I ordered was enough to feed 3 people and caught the attention of everyone within 5 tables. So basically we could hear that the cake was the topic of discussion for everyone near my table. I was reminded of that scene where that little boy sucking down a milkshake in the restaurant stairing at Hank from the movie Me Myself and Irene. I ordered ribs (full rack) which literally came out with absolutely zero seasoning or BBQ sauce, I kid you not. The waitress argued with me so I asked for the manager. The manager agreed that the ribs were not prepared properly and had them fixed. They came back with a mild braise of BBQ sauce but still nothing like the picture on the menu. Also ordered the BBQ burger with bacon and hands down the worst burger ever. The meat had no seasonings and the quality of their beef is very poor. The only good thing was the chocolate cake. Will not return.

_3DHrmxHuSbckGnu0-bXuA.text: Wasn't impressed.I had fish and chips,ok,wife had 12 oz rib eye ,40% of it was fat .Will try again something different.Still best place for fish & chips in my opinion is village pub.I must add the service was impeccable.

_WXFMJZUJhxrvijlFcKL4Q.text: We're been here quite a few times. Each time we sit at the Patio bar.  We've had great service from Nicole and most of the other bartenders, and today, Scott resolved an issue that involved different information than on their menu.   Plus, we get to watch all the MLB games.  Definitely try the nachos.  It's a huge serving.  The drink specials are the main reason we come back.  Daily and every day specials are great.

qQNyq-wBaOhIvYxyQbvB8Q.text: Food was cold. Nachos sat in the window for 15 mins. Chicken philly was cold. They even burnt the inside of a grilled cheese! Messed up the beer order. Bottom line definitely not coming back here again!

OiZ99py6vRq-m048Af5rTg.text: I don't think our server liked us too much, probably because we had a coupon for their special Zingers - which were pretty tasty. PIC ordered the dinosaur leg aka Ossobucco, it was really tender and soft. Ribs were okay, not very flavorful and needed to ask for extra BBQ sauce.

V_owL2E4olJpTAhpXwXDrw.text: OK I don't write to many reviews but I will give one to Miller's in Henderson. It didn't start well. In a short amount of time we changed wait staff 3 different times. Which you really shouldn't do to the guest to begin with. The football games had just ended and they were cutting staff. That didn't help already having a bad night. Then we decided to just do wings and apps. Well we were ordering 40 wings and wanted 4 different sauces. Now I know they aren't Buffalo Wild Wings but you think you'd like to compete a little and let there be 4 different flavors for 40 wings. We almost walked out. Between a change of wait staff 3 times and only 1 sauce per every 20 to choose from it wasn't helping the evening! But our final waitress Emilee rescued Miller's and our night. She was an amazing waitress. She got us the wings with the 4 flavors which they should have offered a choice to begin with especially if  they were better than Buffalo's wings! So Miller's get 4 stars from me for delicious wings and Emilee whos personality saved the establishment and the night.

xJ4eCDmVUqK-92EXlmMGLA.text: Food was good, monday night rack of rib special, meat fell right off the bones! service at the table was good. My only complaint was when we walked in the door, the hostess ignored us for a time as she was too busy hiding her cell phone inside her drawer at her podium and texting.

otmLAGkCHfdxk3TUiTF1Jg.text: Went with my parents during their visit. They have been to one in Florida a couple times and raved about the food. I ordered a buffalo chicken sandwich and it was huge! I was in the mood for wings but I'm picky about how they're prepared. Didn't know their zingers were on special because our server never mentioned it. Sandwich was good, service average. Upon receiving our bill, we noticed it wasn't ours. Honest mistake. I'll probably come back but not until they get things in order with service and  being fairly new.

5bWkFFazVirT8SxlUxC_mw.text: Was disappointed in their food quality and think they need better cooks.  My filet mignon came out medium rare the first time when I ordered medium...the manager came out and said they were remaking it and said it was very close...I questioned what he meant by very close when I ordered medium and it looked like tuna sushi uncooked and it was defiantly undercooked and the soft butter wouldn't melt on the potato.  No problem they would remake all.  The second time it came out it was medium well and no one asked how it was done and I was too hungry to send back. OK so my advice to them get a cook that can cook a steak or remove it from your menu completely! Also, what cook doesn't season with salt and pepper?  It was the most bland of meat I've ever tasted and I eat steak at least once a week.  I don't recommend steak at all there the service was friendly and efficient but manager seemed like he also didn't know what a medium steak looked like...it is pink all the way thru but not raw with an 1/16 the inch brown on each side!  My son felt bad on mother's day that I got to watch him eat.  Their signature dessert was nothing spectacular at all.

Fasg_LEG38DyG9C_yZMiqQ.text: So four of us and a kid decided to try this place out. We had not been to the town square location so this was our first time trying it out. When we entered the hostess wasn't very engaging. I talked first saying that there was four of us and a kid. She asked what type of seating we preferred. I requested a booth and she told the woman next to her (which I am guessing is management?) the seat number and then the woman took us to our table. Not a very friendly hostess. Also the woman who took us back wasn't very engaging either.  Lisa was our server and if I was just giving her a review, I would give her 5 stars. :) she was very friendly, didn't try to upsell us to the point where it was annoying and she was attentive.  The food was mediocre. I had the chicken nachos. They were HUGE but barely had any cheese on them? Uhm hello. Nachos = cheese thanks. My sister had their zingers. She said they were eh. She's had better at Buffalo Wild Wings. The boys had steaks. They didn't have any complaints. But you can't really mess up a steak.  Overall, I probably won't be coming back.

ZJxDJ3OhVfNkwX4iAFTqow.text: 5 stars for service and -5 for the hostesses so I went with 3. The hostesses barely greeted us at the door and didn't say a word to us when we left. I hate rude people. They should be appreciative that they have a job.

zGLuRcKZEfpp7Il2PYumwg.text: Food is fairly decent, your typical American food fare. Wide range of drinks, beers and alcohol. However every time we have gone the waitstaff has been pretty poor. Takes a while to be greeted and we rarely get checked on and our servers are never anywhere in sight.

oe43aIdd9clIn4OkaqTXtw.text: The beer selection was great and reasonably priced. I was not impressed at all with their Zingers (chicken fingers) or the happy hour appetizers. The server was nice and it was a good atmosphere but probably won't come back unless it was for drinks with the guys.

llZgcy8cRRnk5V-QxSXVcg.text: Me and my husband went here and we were very disappointed! We were seated very quickly and the good came out fairly fast but, the Service was awful! Very unorganized, when they brought out food nobody knew which table it went to. The steak was mostly fat and didn't have any flavor at all! The burger I got was very un-flavorful as well! Won't be back.

SeJzZHMwsTFU1KFjk1_c5w.text: The server Alex was awesome... The reason for the bad review is because of the food... it was disgusting... I would never eat here again. I would train the kitchen staff how to cook better. I had to send the fish back because it smelled and tasted expired. It had a bad smell and when I tried it i had to spit it into a napkin because I could not swallow it. I asked for a chicken sandwich instead which was dry and tasteless... I will never come back here due to the food...

wJSHFYNLOL96M4FeuW0EFg.text: My husband and I went in for dinner on Saturday and was greeted by a hostess that was very friendly and seated promptly. The food server came over quickly and took our drink order after making suggestions and telling us about the specials. All good so far, then the food came. I love seafood and ordered the seafood platter. Shrimp, scallops, clams, all okay. Fish was so oily I had to remove the coating to even try to it it. Overall not a bad experience. Fast forward late lunch on Wednesday. Again the hostess was great. Food server came over to take our order, no enthusiasm at all. The place was not busy at all so that wasn't it. She didn't offer any suggestions, did not explain the specials, nothing, just acted like we were interrupting her day. We received our food, delivered by someone else. She finally passed by and asked if our food was okay. My husband had ordered the special of the day which was a country steak that had very little gravy so he asked her for more gravy. He waited more than 5 minutes before he started to eat his by then cold food. The food server passed by with some drinks for another table, still no gravy. I asked if that was our food server and was assured that it was, so I asked where the gravy was, no answer. She finally brought a small cup of gravy and plopped down on the table and walked away without a word. By then he was almost finished with his meal. My tea glass was empty and as she passed by again she pointed at my glass, not saying anything, I said yes please I would love more tea. She took the glass and went behind a partition with it. She then came back out and went to refill my glass from a tea container that was in full view of our table. She brought the glass back and put it on the table and didn't acknowledge my "thank you." I wouldn't drink that tea because I was concerned about what she did with that glass out of my view. Would be better if they had pitchers for refills. Don't think we'll be going back.

N9hOuiQV3WCDYZ0-FYqO3Q.text: My husband  go here at least three to four times a month for the last few years mainly for the prime rib special. We both enjoy prime ribs and Miller's is excellent. The other day we ordered our usual which included two sides, a baked potato and a salad. The menu states the meal includes two sides. The meal was great as usual including the drinks. When the waiter brought the bill we were charged for the salads. The waiter stated the salads were not considered sides. He then referred it to the manager. The manager went into a long winded explanation why salads are not considered a side dish. He said we got the Cole slaw and potato as the two sides. I told him I didn't order the Cole slaw nor was I offered any choices. The manager dug in his heals and stated I'd have to pay for the salad and he was not going to take it off the bill. Well I said I guess I will pay it and looking at him I could see the smirk that he had won a great victory. This is indicative of why businesses lose customers.  The two stars are for the treatment we received not the food.

ChW2HfXfXWLadGx8cKV8sA.text: Again another GREAT experience Angel! Thanks so much for your WONDERFUL service.  We will definitely be back next week if not sooner.  This is the best late-night hang out in Henderson!

PPevAzXm9Yz2kVfT9oIaPQ.text: Ehh. Online says there's vegetarian options on menu. There was only one (Morning Star veggie burger) so unless they have a separate menu. Everything was very large and looked like standard American food. My family enjoyed it I think except my gluten free aunt got grilled chicken and they flattened it and cooked it til it was sawdust! And dessert was subpar, their brownies weren't very chocolately and the ice cream on top tasted similar to the stuff that comes out of the giant plastic buckets at the grocery store.

wL4k3_4E1TU-rxfaOTf2gw.text: Same restaurant, different location. I don't really care for the other Miller's Ale House, but as usual, I was here for a birthday dinner. They were really busy, however, they have a very convenient system of texting you when your table is available. I received an initial text telling me the wait time (25 minutes) and a hyperlink with more information. We ended up getting a table within 12 minutes and a prompt text alerting us of it.  Our server was nice and very attentive (he checked on us at least three times throughout the meal), however, our food didn't reflect our orders exactly. Small errors though like Ruben's burger coming back medium rather than medium rare and the wrong sauce on our chicken; so it was nothing too upsetting.  Ruben and I shared an order of their Zingers ($9.99). The intention was to have the chicken strips tossed in medium AND BBQ sauces, but it came out with just medium sauce. Actually, it was swimming in a bowl of sauce. It made everything soggy and the batter was falling off when we tried to fish it out. It was so weird and kinda gross. It was also not nearly as good as I remember it, which is sad because this was the only thing I enjoyed at Miller's. Also, their ranch isn't very tasty.  I had the Blackened Chicken Key Lime Salad and Ruben had the British Burger with Fries. The salad was all right. Nothing spectacular in appearance or taste. The dressing was bland; I couldn't taste the key lime at all. The tortilla strips were just broken up pieces of tortilla chips, which was awkward when some of the pieces were larger than half dollar coins. Ruben seemed to enjoy his burger for the most part (besides the burger temperature issue). Oh, and their fries are flavorless.  I really don't care for their food or the restaurant in general and wish people would stop choosing their restaurants for gatherings. In any case, I'll end with some positives: there are many televisions with several different games and sports, so it's a great spot to catch a game with your friends; the prices are cheap; and the kids' activity book is very detailed.

8DpzvGEUOOXbpUvERgmK9w.text: Went in to Miller's ale house to get some lunch with a client and was sat in terra section and was extremely pleased with the service we received!

SxkwoBXz2NnXlt8KbsRlEw.text: Thanks Chad! Great service! Our go to place for hockey and football because of you! Great food, beer selection, and can't forget about our hostess! Just awesome all the way!!

c7uMH-puwK9rZDK90J5jlA.text: Request Jason !!!!!! He is the best  Dinner was fantastic, ambiance nice and cozy.... TV screens everywhere ! Luv it

photos.caption: Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. Cups are huge !!!! Jason made me a strawberry lemonade... Not on menu
Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. Shrimp Alfredo !!! 35 shrimp

TM77TmbYl-m2WCy8dO2MHA.text: This place is fantastic. The food was fresh tasty and filling. The best part of our dining experience was our server. Our server's name is Summer. Nothing better than service with a smile.  Try the steak sandwich. Get Summer as your waitress and you will have a pleasant dining experience.

UCU8gpjfHJYTghSq9tPsMw.text: Jose was our server and he was great. Very attentive, friendly and always there when we needed him.   We ordered two kids meals (spaghetti and meatballs) and it was big portions. Hidden gem for us from the kids menu is it comes with ice cream or ice cream sandwich!  For appetizer we ordered the fried calamari. It comes with Thai sweet Chili Sauce mixed in and for us it would have been better on the side.   We ordered the 35 shrimp scampi for dinner and it was great. The wife and I shared that and it was more than enough for two people. At 12.99 can't go wrong with that and they weren't kidding when they say 35 shrimp.

34x880LYsRVty93UEKWYBQ.text: Tara is a great waitress with a great memory! Great food as well! Great atmosphere. Plenty of view tables for any sport!

photos.caption: Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. Tara is a great waitress! Great food! Great atmosphere!

VRxyYNaJmZEXuTOVkj4Zmg.text: Best grilled chicken sandwich and ribs in years. Hot.  Ribs marinated in bbq sauce for  hours.

4Auzq2QHWa_xq20i88ZKOg.text: The only thing I could come up with was maybe because I'm a woman, I asked for the boneless wings and a beer. What I got was greasy wings with the bone in. The bartender never stopped back by. The two men at the bar got great service. Not a place I would come back too.

O_PxUfTGnFgqJZjfhwPzpQ.text: Servers only care about what you leave them for a tip. Come back after not leaving a good enough tip for them even after a bad service you won't even be properly served because they'll probably remember you. Food was cold, managers won't do anything about it. They know people will continue to come and buy so they could care less about one customer. Guess it's how most places are now days. Won't be coming back, mostly due to poor service. Food wasn't the worst besides it being cold but can't enjoy my food with rude attitudes and being served by salesman.

cInniQmnrHEWvmPI3wRM4A.text: Great service from Jillian L.  She was very enthusiastic and friendly.  Good service, affordable food and great drink specials.  Easy parking too.

zToQ_NdWVfD-dz9ZRfVOOQ.text: First off..... let me start by saying this was THE WORST bartender I have EVER EVER had! Heather had NO idea what the specials were... let alone what type of beer they had. Literally every question we asked she just stood there with a blank stare on her face and said.... " uh...... I dunno! " and just stood there.  Then when it came time to order food... oh I swear she straight lost her brain completely!  My bf just asked for regular steak fries instead of the sweet potato ones. Once again the look on her face was priceless!  She then went around the entire bar asking people questions to which we had no clue what was so confusing. .. When she got back to us she looked at us and said... "we are all out of steak fries! " I looked at her and replied " so you're telling me you guys don't have regular french fries? !" She all of the sudden dropped her jaw and just stood there again....  Ok enough.   Food was ok.... service from Heather was terrible until the end of the night when bartender Candy came up and basically told us that EVERYTHING Heather said wasn't available to us all night ACTUALLY was... candy is the only thing saving this review.   Sorry guys but I can just imagine how much $$$ you lose on a weekend night with someone like her behind the bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. Bbq chicken pizza and spinach dip
Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. $8 pitcher of bud light

yaczTS8BhJBS2jrldGCB5w.text: I have come here fairly often since it opened mostly because my friends and I really liked their fish and chips. The last time I was disappointed as the size was smaller and it didn't taste like before. My wife and I went last night. She had a chicken sandwich which was good. She asked for fries crispy...they were limp. I decided to try the shrimp scampi linguine. Bad choice. I ate about half. Shrimp was weird texture, kind of rubbery, sauce was bland and sticky. Our server, Linda was very good and attentive. Offered to get me something different but I was done. Manager came by even though the place was packed and busy. He offered to bring something else but I declined. He apologized and removed the meal from the bill although I told him that wasn't necessary. So that was much appreciated and I will go back and perhaps stick to more bar type food! We Don't frequent sports bar places as they tend to be loud and distracting but usually like Millers. My thanks to our server and manager for their attention.

dq4azisz1npCX3uEg_G1vQ.text: My birthday dinner with my parents went pretty well. We had a good time here. They have different areas to the restaurant. There is a regular area with booths and an indoor patio with tables and a bar. All the staff were friendly and helpful with accommodating us.  I ordered a virgin pina colada which was better then i expected. We had the peppironi flat bread and zingers for appetizers which were very good. I ordered the fish and chips which were very filling. My mom ordered the shrimp scampy. She loved the shrimp, but did not care for the noodles. My dad ordered the combination fajitas and he said they were perfect. And the rasberry iced tea was incredible.  All the portions were good sized for the money spent. I also was suppose to get a piece of cake for my birthday, but my dad has a nut allergy. They gave us ice cream instead. The waitresses were very on the ball. Filled drinks and cleaned table very quickly. We had two because one was in training . We will be coming back for sure.

S7VXDiBxi1lCc5x26mEbhg.text: Most people wouldn't write a Yelp review after a evening out for drinks, but I'm not most people. Miller's was very welcoming and a relax atmosphere. From being the smiling hostess to the very attentive bartender the service was great. The food was ok, but in fairness I stuck with good drinking food. It is also worth mentioning the bar is covered in tv's. This is the place to watch the game or the fight. I will be back again, and maybe I will write another review when I haven't been heavily drinking.

t97P-Nch3-W-FywNRkTnkg.text: Sure, it's a chain restaurant. But this place has a lot going for it. Great prices, great service, and pretty good food. And if you can find a daily special that sparks your interest, there's no reason not to stop in.  My husband and I were running errands in Henderson, and neither of us had been to Miller's Ale House so we thought we'd give it a try. Midafternoon on Memorial Day, and it was not very crowded, so we were seated quickly and were well looked after. My husband ordered the Monday special, which was a rack of ribs for $9.99 ($8 off regular price). A pitcher of Bud Light was $8, so it was like getting a pitcher for free! And those ribs were tasty and fall-off-the-bone tender. I had the blackened chicken Key Lime salad, which was pretty good, too. Lightly dressed and a large enough portion that I had leftovers.  As I said, it's a chain restaurant. But there's a reason why many chains succeed: You know what you're getting, no matter where you get it. And I hope that's the case with Miller's Ale House, because the Henderson location is a bit far from our house but I can easily see us trying one somewhere closer to home.

ankIxnp-EBBT69P50Dd7bw.text: Brand spankin new nestled in the heart of Henderson. With specials everyday from rack of ribs, chicken Marsala, prime rib to ribeye steaks. Match it with your favorite brew or a refreshing cocktail..win win situation all around. Flat screens in every angle possible oh and good service. hopefully it stays like this and not because they just opened.   Ps.Tuesdays- Kids eat free and $5 Zingers!

5tEzc44orn7IcmFanPIvGw.text: Let me first say that you can watch UFC fights here for free. That's right free! I couldn't believe it until I walked in on Saturday evening. I am giving the Ale House  5 stars because even during a fight night the service was great. We ordered buckets of 5 beers for $10. The server was always attentive and made sure we were taken care of the entire time we were there. Always a plus in my books!

6YL-knRqyRKWI4qxoS8B7g.text: I've been to the Millers Ale House at Town Square many times and this one is not only conveniently located close to my house but it's way bigger and the staff is awesome from the hostesses to the waiters and the managers. We were checked on often through our meal and we enjoyed the Ufc fights for free. They don't have a cover charge at the Ale houses on fight night. Reasonably priced food and everything is always good. We will be back soon.

z1dUmpj4lQIl9DPk6lS7PA.text: Well. The food is at least pretty good. We've been here four? Times now and always have the same experience. Always sit at the bar. Never get any kind of friendly greeting. Today we even got an eye roll, from Savannah, when we suggested we would start with waters (yes it's Vegas. Yes it's 2:30 in the afternoon. But I haven't had a chance to look at the menu yet!). We ordered our food. Our order seemed to annoy her too. Never a smile. We asked for BBQ sauce. She finished her cleaning before asking the kitchen for it. :/ it's cool. Cold food is still good food. Never got our meal checked on. And our waters stayed empty. Awesome service. :(

LxdgupPQ_gz5wGYoKGCWLw.text: Great atmosphere for the Cotto vs Canelo boxing match. 2 dollar 16 oz cans of PBR. Las Vegas local love. What else could you want?

SsFmzfdC8HUbQO6DJS87Ew.text: I went on a rainy Sunday night. There wasn't a lot of people in there. I got there at 830pm. I was greeted right away and seated. I ordered the French onion soup the cheese was hot and melty but the soup was luke warm. How does that happen. I had a beer and a water at the beginning. I ordered the spicy chicken Alfredo and it was bland not anywhere near spicy and the ends of the chicken pieces were burnt. When my entree was brought out I asked for another beer 20 minutes later no beer. My waiter finally came over and asked me if I needed anything I said yes the beer I asked for about 20 minutes ago . He said the server didn't tell him I wanted one. Way to pass the buck. I finally got it 10 minutes later I won't be going back to this millers ale house. My waiter got a 1 dollar tip

HRf6M2fD2Rf2h7C5fnwpVA.text: I've visited this location at least two times prior but this was by far the worst! Arrived this afternoon to watch an NFL game, was promptly seated by the hostess who was very nice. We had a table in the back bar which was not full. Many open tables. Waitress in a Vikings jersey asked for our drink order and gave us menus. She seemed bothered that we asked for water to start with while we looked over the menu. That was the last time we saw her. The first quarter of the game finished with absolutely no service. The table behind us seemed annoyed as well as one person got up to find some help. That's when we decided to take our business down the street to Sierra Gold. Made sure to let the new hostess know service was lacking (to say the least).  Not a good place if you want good service while cheering in your team!

QiG6UXSRFaxp4Q_wxSvMJw.text: Great service when sitting at the bar top, horrible anywhere else. I sat outside in the patio area with 3 other girls. I would think you couldn't miss us, but we didn't receive a friendly hello or acknowledgment for almost 10 minutes. The food is always just OK, never amazing. Good place to drink at the bar, not so good to have a sit down meal.

cGBWI3lGskZ9MjmRPUAq2g.text: Tried Hederson Millers Ale house tonight.  Got a very nasty bug from the shrimp pasta, not fresh. Avoid this place. Not worth it.  Called the Manager Frank,  who was rude and not interested about the situation.  WILL NEVER RETURN.

33rEi-e2X53NOloN8NNtwQ.text: I checked out this restaurant because I wanted to watch some games with my friends. The service was very nice, the manager even came out & talked to us personally. They were the only redeeming thing about the experience. We ordered a pitcher of Long Island iced tea. There was absolutely no trace of alcohol. Their "world famous zingers" were awful! We got the hottest one, & it wasn't even hot. Their nachos were 90% chips with a tiny handful of mummified cheese on top. I would not recommend this place.

BUn-4xLJdeoYXbfiqQxPmA.text: I got chips and guacamole/salsa for appetizer it was pretty good and the build your own burger, double bacon with cheddar cheese and the usual fixings. Cooked medium with fries. It was mighty tasty I must say and huge! I will return!

mNoXtFBqGo23BYhzn_fGPQ.text: Came in with a group of 6, kinda slow and sadly enough so was the service. Let them know that were active duty and vets and they declined out discount. I Was at the other Ale House at town square and they always give a military discount. Guess this Ale House in Henderson doesn't share the same appreciation for our military members.

5yWJK2Dto4jjYsa0mvs2pA.text: Came here on a Friday night. Ate at the bar. Service was awesome and our server was extremely cool to let us split our bills without rolling her eyes. She was great. The food, however, was a little on the bland side. Ordered the fish and chips and a chicken quesadilla appetizer. Both were on the bland side and needed a little more salt. I will say this, the fish and chips portion was huge and enough for two to share, the chicken quesadilla was only $5 as part of the happy hour specials, and the atmosphere was pretty cool. I will definitely return and give it another shot, if not for the food, definitely for the drinks and atmosphere.

z1L0BY0kL8Ocpp_Fypncow.text: I really like Millers but this place is horrible at transitioning from the early to afternoon games on Sundays. The "it'll be on these tv's after these games are over" excuse is unacceptable. All the tv's are showing the same games!!!!  You're telling me with your high tech audio room you can't change some channels? It's either lazy or incompetent.

MwskOPwaf9YHjYBaR7YubQ.text: I've been here twice with my boyfriend, both times we have sat at the bar that it inside the restaurant. The first time we came here was fine, the bartender was decent but it was the end of her shift and it was clear that she was over it and ready to go home.  The second time we came in and walked strait up to the bar and were treated by a manager. My boyfriend asked if she would put a game on for him (as he is pulling the bar stool out to sit down and I am already sitting at the bar) she said to him "Yeah! I'll put the game on once you decide where you're going to sit!" In a very rude tone. I thought it was clear where we were planning on sitting due to the fact that, well, I was sitting. That kind of set the mood of our visit, it just wasn't pleasant. The food was good I will say, and the man that helped us was very good about making sure our food was prepared correctly which was important to me (I have a food allergy).  I would recommend this place for the food and awesome beer selection but don't expect great service.

QnKp4wV-SzWOWgNq4KrohQ.text: Rib eye was over cooked and bland. I sent it back and got the same exact thing. No bueno.  Zingers are good, but don't order a steak at the Henderson Miller's.

qB_66RH_ygjxV3n_elZ-Tw.text: Second time in a month.  Excellent experience again.  We were seated promptly and attended to quickly.  Service was attentive,  accurate and friendly.  Food, we ordered the ribeye both times.  Both times,  steaks were cooked correctly and we're juicy and full of flavor.  Excellent value for the money.  Friendly and fun. You won't walk out hungry

94jxKJXYD_INvfcbvjlUvw.text: A co- worker and I would come here all the time on our lunch breaks.  The service is slow at times but the food is good. They did change the size of their drinks though. A great place to watch sports or have a fantasy league draft. They have dozens of televisions all over with sports on all the time so that you won't miss anything.

Dcxiyc607TeijgWYZgbBKQ.text: This is a large group review. We celebrated a friends bridal shower here. We went early around 11 or 11:30 hoping to beat the weekend lunch craziness. Sevice was incredibly slow and it about 2 hours to get our food. Our waitress was very inattentive and I kept on having to get up to go find someone to help us with drinks. We have been here before with smaller groups and have had a great experience so I was disappointed with our larger group. 1 server for 15 people was just not sufficient.

wqX4g3Xq7AnO_Jrn7Man0A.text: The food took for ever then when it came out it was cold. The manager was good he did come out and apologize

However, came here for lunch and 20 minutes later I still have no drink. Oh, and six waitresses have walked past me but not said a word. What great customer service! Kudos to you....

0IJ9mP9a7KoWROtXXn0fRA.text: Very upset I have been coming here to watch football most weeks when in town, and take vendors there for lunches. Today I went there to watch football and they had the same game on twice at both bars and wouldn't show the game I wanted to watch. I'm so upset I really liked going there and pass several bars getting a taxi to go.

nJMVdnPz1fRqtIBEsO8VXA.text: Absolutely phenomenal service AND food! We came in (my good girlfriend and I) after she had foot surgery-(still in a lot of pain but wanting to get out of the house)... we brought her service dog and were welcomed with open arms! From the outstanding management who greeted us at the door to the VERY pleasant servers, Tara H & Jillian- we couldn't of been happier. We needed a LOT of extra time due to the handicap situation and my friend being on meds that they gave us and we appreciated! NO ONE rushed us at all from taking our order to answering our 20 questions on the diff meals! They were MOST welcoming and accommodating! The shrimp & chicken salad that we both ordered was SUPER tasty & my mojito was superb! Thank you to the staff & management, it's obvious your customer service skills has started from the top of management and worked its way down! Love seeing a great & happy staff as I worked for One of the largest casino industries in the world for the food & Bev department for many years and Only wish our dept was just as happy all the time hah! Thank you again!

S7Po37NZR5SRbWsMc2d4_A.text: I would give them five stars but the food came out wrong.   I sent it back and it came back worse.   Then in walks a manager who saved the day.   She took one look, said she'd fix it and she did.   She definitely made it right.   And to my surprise the general manager came over and apologized as well.   This place is top notch.  Check it out.  You'll be glad you did.

hOGa-PWlzHI8QoBSNczyfQ.text: Great food... As always! One of our family's favorite restaurants. Chicken Philly was great! Service was quick and very friendly!

bdSpYouPnhzTsmYGiuXnNQ.text: Burgers, wings, pizza and beer during sports Zingers, prime rib, salad and cocktails on dates  I will never have two pitchers of electric blue lit again til maybe October  not DD

UW7q_HZ8it_-1edyn2L9YQ.text: Food is very good. Service is great.. Our waiter Corte is funny and gives off a great vibe.. It's nice to eat and chill out where you can visit with family and not be rushed.. I'll be back soon.

7SVuIrt3TykqaPJJXtRxTQ.text: I always enjoy. They do sports pub better than most. Nothing that knocks your socks off but solid up and down the lineup like the Texas Rangers. Surprising good salads with mixed lettuces and fresh dressings. Tenders are good but order sauce on side since they can be tossed haphazardly. Servers are attentive and they have all the sports packages so you can find your team.

FtMbXSMtBO8-qba5wBQnNQ.text: This is a pretty decent joint that's working on improving to match the standards set by the location at Town Square.  A while back, I had a credit card snafu where they both lost my card and double charged me, and was really unhappy with management's reaction (or lack thereof). That said, they followed up later and made things right.   The prices are all pretty reasonable, and the service is normally solid for the size of the restaurant. It's also a fantastic place to watch sports. They have a ton of huge TVs.  The only questionable aspect of this location is the consistency of the food. The menu is great, but they don't hit on quality every time compared to the Town Square location. I'm sure that's just some growing pains, though. I've had a few prime rib or lobster specials that have come out a little incorrectly cooked, and mahi mahi that was tiny and came out with 3 pieces of broccoli.  But, if you like sports and seafood, make sure to stop by! They do a lot of the right thing here.

ZrlBukCeQTwi-QZFBs0drw.text: Extremely disappointed in our recent experience! We have been loyal customers for almost a year, because we love the atmosphere and it's close to home. We always order steak and my husband usually adds a lobster. Each time we go in its a gamble, sometimes our meal comes out as requested, other times our food is overcooked and tough! When that happens we bring it to our servers attention and they usually make it right by remaking or discounting our meal, but that is not a request we make each time. My husband even told our server beforehand this visit that last time his lobster was overcooked so he wanted them to be aware and careful , as it's a $10 add on so he wants to actually enjoy it. Today my husbands lobster came out and it was beyond obvious it was old! The smell was awful, even the table next to us commented on how foul the smell was. The manager took it and told us he would take it off our bill. The server was sweet and apologized saying she didn't smell it as she was bringing it out but when she went in the back she smelled something bad and the other servers told her it was ours. There's nothing like the smell of old fish to ruin your appetite, but we hadn't eaten all day so we needed to eat. I thought for sure the manager would have rectified the situation with some sort of discount on our bill but he didn't. When confronted about it he only felt it was fair to remove the old lobster even though our entire experience was ruined by the smell. He asked what my husband thought would be fair and my husband said 50% off. The manager was extremely unprofessional and arrogant from that point on and said he wasn't going to do 50% just because my husband didn't like his lobster. My husband went on to explain it wasn't because he didn't like it and more that it was old and had such a foul smell that lingered in the air and on your fingers from touching it. I only picked up the empty shell but had to wash my hands because everytime I brought my fork to my mouth to take a bite I would get a whiff of it. They went back and forth and he said I'll just take care of the whole meal I'll even tip the girl . It was obvious he was not doing this because he genuinely cared about our satisfaction as customers, he was mocking us. He walked away and came back to our table saying his staff recognized us and that we always cause problems and he would have to ask us not to come back! Talk about humiliating! We weren't looking for a handout we just expected more than sub par customer service and that is not what you will get at this establishment!! We put our kids in the car and my husband went back in to speak to a different manager and the other manager came up and said to my husband "I asked you to leave you are trespassing I'm going to call the police!" Way to escalate a situation! Moral of the story take your business elsewhere because this is Vegas and there are many other places with a similar atmosphere and much better food. This place just happened to be close to home and convenient for us! Maybe we should call the health department, I can't imagine serving rotten lobster is ok!

-I8VpWGuym8LlDoXFVmHXw.text: My wife and I ate at Miller's last Sunday. The food and service was excellent as always, our server was taking good care of us. Defiantly a great place to go for good food and good times, we have found that the Henderson location does tend to get crowded at times, that should say something.

cM_suvwCdJYGbEPKDurLhQ.text: Second meal at Ale House. First time much better. This time poor service. Service very unpersonable. No recommendations. Ordered light fare zingers but had to choose between broccoli or carrots couldn't have some of both so,changed to zinger salad. Server didn't ask,if I wanted original or grilled which she should have since I had wanted the light fare originally. She asked me what sauce I wanted and I said what are my choices she pointed with her pen not saying a word like I was putting her out. My husband ordered a burger, medium, and it was well done, so,kind of dry. Server did not come back to check on us. Just a poor experience and manager almost had the same attitude. If I try again it will be at town square not Henderson.

KU7vO90b7qKD5sNWH614Sw.text: We used Millers for a gender reveal baby party this last weekend. I had called around numerous places and was quoted ridiculous prices and was also told to call morning of party to order. I wasn't ok with that. I went into Millers in Henderson and spoke to the manager Thursday night and he was super friendly. He was able to meet my request for almost half of what I was quoted elsewhere! We picked up the order Saturday afternoon and everything was delicious! We order two types of wings, two orders of the mini burgers and they were able to put together platter of potato skins even though they weren't on the party menu. Everyone loved the food. The only thing that was missing was the celery that was supposed to come with wings. We had plenty of other food anyways! Thanks!

I-hrggd8tAZOuSLuHh3v5w.text: Great prime rib! Thanks for the great food and service!Been here several times! Celebrated my Birthday here the another night also! Great Lobster and service as usual! Thanks again!

BxurHKmAdluqB1rOdqHQ4A.text: Good Food Good Friendly, Hostes and Servers. They actualy check up on you a minuit or two after your foods been deliverd.  Open late. I will return many more times.

BECLcBnsf7aVuyxyWgw7XQ.text: Brand new....and just a quick drive from our house. Plenty of television throughout the restaurant. Great service. Reasonable prices on food & drinks. Yeah...we'll be back!!! :)

G2SRhJ3VCkAFIEMisoLMGg.text: Great Happy Hour, or a place to watch some football or UFC. Great cheerful staff that helped get anything I needed with quick service.

XGT7-2-yhQDlkhHxMqfJww.text: Oh my gosh!!!!! My new favorite restaurant and bar. Great food, great service and it's so inexpensive. You can dine in the casual atmosphere of the restaurant or they have a section in the back that's a little more Rowdy with games and sporting events on tv.

Iq-nq4YwfDT3Ly4qvY3RjQ.text: I've heard of this place at Town Square, but never been and when I saw they opened in Henderson near my house I figured I should check them out. Fantastic food!  My husband got the seafood mix, it had lobster tail, crab legs, potatoes, oysters, etc and he loved it. I stayed safe and got the Bistro burger, it was huge and delicious. I was pleasantly surprised by the side salad!  It was large portion and delicious...not just lettuce and croutons thrown in a bowl like most restaurants do.   We will definitely be back for more!!

mNdO82ViavTlAxtkhBnh3Q.text: I went here a couple of nights ago and i LOVE this place..I almost always order the zingers because they are one of a kind...i had excellent service the other night from NATHAN..oh, and the drinks are great ..will definitely be going back

0URExk10SoZTSKzyboKtig.text: So I've been looking forward to having a meal here. I see plenty of cars so that means it's good right? Not really. Just a place with the "new" buzz to it.  The hostess were friendly enough. I'm not a fan of giving my phone number so they could text me when my table was ready. Just give me a vibrating hockey puck like everywhere else. You don't need my number.  I look at the beer menu and see Yuengling! Woohoo! I order one for my wife and I and am told "we don't have that." Lame. Next, I order a Leffe. Guess what, same response, "we don't have that." Great beer menu, weak actual beer selection.  I ordered the oriental chicken, it was decent. Wife had a burger, same thing, decent.  When we left, my wife summed it up best: "It's not Yard house, but it's better than McDonalds."

N6OzmCDQD8e1IMp4lzaUvg.text: First time here. Food was exceptionally good. Plenty of it too.  Fish and chips outstanding.

TkfNTIn65s2VCmUmBDbVRg.text: Our server Chantelle was awesome.  She had a great personality and helped people in our party make some menu decisions.  She deserves 5 stars herself.  The food was not bad, I had the prime rib French beef and it was a pretty good portion sandwich, definitely better then most places in town.  The food was good, I was pleased with it, my friends ordered the Capt'n Jack desert and it was not bad either.  Overall it was a good experience.  My only complaint is that they NO LONGER give a Military Discount, yet on Memorable Day they want all military to come in and eat.  I say ALL military should go because they offer the military person only 50% off your item.  Let's flood them and make them pay as many 50% as possible because they only want to appreciate veterans on a day instead of all the time.  We protect them 24/7, they should appreciate that everyday.

eZLToJ3rb5_tIYFYawb-sQ.text: Summer is THE BEST bartender!! Go see her always! Chive tv is the best, mules are good. Don't get the steak

yBqirKdzcjnCVvvh33iNYw.text: Best Turkey burger ever. I am not lying.  I only wish they offered beer flights.  I tried the Kona Longboard Lager and liked it.  It did make me think of Hawaii...overtones of pineapple?

RW-RdQdc0x2icIDu-PiVKw.text: Ate here a couple of times, great to watch sports and get a good burger or pizza love there appetizers can't go wrong with anything. I enjoy there buffalo wings good deserts too.

RbxhH18V5-JmQpbGlX5-5w.text: It's been 3 years since I have been here and this time food was good, drink good, service...polite but have to flag them down, they are too busy hanging out with other staff, joking and carrying on. Restaurant is slow so perhaps this is why.

xH3J6z-fwuLXhI1Jn94LlQ.text: This was fine.  Lots of screens, cold beer, normal bar food, just what you'd expect for a sports  bar.  We had a large group and fine service.  Most of the entrees were served promptly, but the five-beer buckets always arrived on time.  Appetizers were good, chicken wings crisp and properly sauced, like the customers.  No complaints.

HN6c13pAcusE9Yxd5HHOXg.text: For an "ale house" their beer selection is pretty poor. I ended up going with a cocktail, which wasn't bad, but I would have preferred a decent beer.  I ate a build-my-own burger, which wasn't too bad. It's hard to mess up when you're selecting the ingredients you're putting on your burger.  All in all not bad, but not great.

Ubh-PgVHiMx5jGgmQtQKUQ.text: Me and a group of eight of my friends decided to watch this little hockey game called the Stanley Cup playoffs at Miller's Ale house last night. My friends and I arrived in shifts which means we ordered our appetizers our main dish and our drinks in shifts we also asked for all separate checks we were a waiters nightmare. Our amazing waiter Cody handled our table all night with none of us ever needing a drink without him coming to the table to ask the place was completely packed and he was running all night but yet we never ever waited for him or looked for him he always came back to the table checked on us make sure we have food and drinks at all times he did an absolutely amazing job so these five stars go to Cody we love Miller's Ale house always but Cody did an absolutely amazing job with a packed restaurant!!

ZV8Xqhtl21gSL8WnxqkPAA.text: Great Father's Day lunch!  Our server, Nathan, was the best. Refills on point.  Drinks and food fast.  Hubby happy with his chicken nachos.  Mini man will have those zingers for lunch again tomorrow!  Little girl enjoyed her chicken strips, apples, and ice cream.  I went outside of my wheelhouse and got the shrimp tacos.  Surprisingly good.    Forget that Miller's is close to our house.  Great happy hour specials we need to return for!

8fYGKAqz84p4g9-5op6Epw.text: With a couple of Miller's Ale House locations in the valley, it was really only a matter of time before I made it to one.  It should not have taken a visit from some out-of-towners to get me here but there you have it.  I met up with some friends who wanted a place we could visit, eat and grab a beer.  I was surprised when I walked in, in a good way, with the appearance and size of Miller's.  It is a big restaurant with kind of a small pub feel (think dark wood and brass rails). At the same time, I am reminded of a steak and seafood restaurant not unlike the Sizzler's I grew up at.  It is a welcome addition to my restaurant familiarity.  The three of us were seated immediately and our server was at the table before we even had a chance to pick up the menues.  A quick order of beer, a mojito and an iced tea and we commenced to talking.  Our poor server kept trying to take our order but we were too busy gabbing to know what we wanted.  We ended up with wings, steak and crab legs and a Philly Cheese Steak sandwich (fully loaded).  It took a little while for the food to come out.  Perhaps longer than I think it should have but it gave us time to chat so it wasn't really an issue.  As I did not try the wings, steak or crab legs, I will discuss now the cheese steak only.  As mentioned before, I ordered my sandwich fully loaded.  There was a ton of thin sliced beef, a couple slices of melted provolone and sauteed vegetables (green pepper, onion and mushrooms).  This was a good Philly.  I am always on the lookout for a nice sandwich like this.  I will file this away in my memory for quick access in the future.  On the side I went with regular fries.  They were fine.  Thick cut and all.  That said, I wish I had ordered another side.  These fries were heavily seasoned with salt and pepper.  I dislike black pepper and only enjoy limited salt.  This was a little much.  My final impressions of Miller's Ale House, favorable.  I can see this being a good place to come for a cold beer and some good food.  Service was on point and pricing is reasonable ($9 and change for a sandwich and fries).  The booth seats are not exaclty comfortable with no padding on the backs or seats but for the hours or so that you will likely be in here to eat, you'll live.

Bw12a45Lf7dEPuGD9h_uTA.text: It was my first time. The food was excellent timing of it coming out was also perfect,,, loved the server very nice n made sure everything was perfect if you go in ask for Ariana she's an excellent server thank you for the perfect service....

dSq463K-ZbB5ZQAt63MTyA.text: Ok, to start I normally avoid chains. This one advertises lots of taps and Wednesday was lobster night. $19 for a lobster dinner sounded good.  Great service. Just awesome. Cortae and Pua are 2 of the best bartenders ever. Lobster was perfect. Not over cooked as usual. Food was all spot on. The MANAGER was even working. He was serving and on the floor making it happen. Nice guy even though I don't agree with his politics.   Beer selection was great too. Had some great local taps. Hendertucky from Joseph James is one fantastic IPA.   One chain I will not avoid at least in Henderson.

photos.caption: Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Miller's Ale House - Henderson - Henderson, NV, United States. Before and after lobster photos. That bug gave his all and I left nothing but shell and lungs.

hMo_0T1FGzzStcO2fySL_A.text: One of the few chains I am happy eating at on a regular basis is Miller's Ale House. I have been here at least 5 times, and other than a couple minor disappointments that I will touch on in this review, I've had many good experiences.   Pros:  Selection! A little big of everything. Want a salad, steak, fish, or potstickers? They have all of those.    Service. Happy, perky people. Almost always. Appreciated.   Price. Deals!! Daily specials. Alcohol & happy hours. YESSSSSS.  Game day. TV's for days!!!!!!!! As Allison S. would say, "ALL THE GAMES!!"  Cons:  Salads. Haven't found one I enjoy, the freshness just is not there.   Consistency. I hate when places run out of stuff, or say they have a daily soup, but that soup isn't there.   Weak Drinks. Sangria pitcher for $10 sounds wonderful. No, super watered down.   I can't really think of other cons. It is overall a really decent place to eat. I left quality out of either selection because you get what you pay for. The food is decent, not over the top amazing. But would you expect a $12 steak to be the best ever?  It also can be great for a family dinner, or a girls night out. Above average chain food at its finest!

pcg18w_4LmT1P8uvwAk6sA.text: Always drove pass this place today I decided to visit most day it's a total sports bar. The atmosphere was great and the food was good we had the fish and chips and jambalaya. Will definitely  go back

hpxpXImP8ebGw5G4Ks--Vw.text: 5 stars down the board. I've actually never heard of this place. After an intense gym session, Nieves D. suggested Millers Ale house. You had me at Ale! I guess they just opened a Henderson location. The old one is at Town Square.  Upon arriving, it was packed! But this place is very spacious with loads of parking. We found Carl I. and Baby TJ finishing up their meal and joined them.   32oz pitcher for $10, you can choose from white/red sangria, loaded Arnold Palmer, margarita, electric blue LIT or mojito. The pitcher wasn't as big as I imagined but it was actually perfect for just us two. The drinks on the menu are pretty cheap though.   They have daily specials so I ordered Thursdays special which was the Prime Rib for $12.95. Comes with 1 side so I got loaded French fries. Prime rib was pretty darn delicious. Cooked to perfection and just the right amount to feed my hungry muscles.   We also ordered calamari due to Nieves D's obsession. It was drizzled with sweet chili sauce. It was really good. It wasn't over cooked and rubbery which usually happens with calamari.   Service was on point. Our server today was Brittney. She had loads of personality and very helpful. A little on the chatty side but she was extra funny. Overall, cheap foods, good food, cheap drinks, good drinks, great experience will be returning as soon as possible.

2uBKcHsxd09NH4X7AGtDvg.text: Such a disappointment. We used to love this place, after it first opened. They had great weekly deals, happy hour deals on both beer and appetizers, and good quality food (hamburgers used to be amazing! Now are so terrible). Over time it's gotten more expensive and the food is such poor quality. It seems like they've gotten stingy.   Last night I had a Caesar salad. For $5 I got a tiny plate of wilted, soggy lettuce, almost all of which was iceberg. I had to ask for more dressing because there was almost none on it. Our appetizer didn't have nearly enough chips to eat all the spinach dip. The serving of fries that came with my husband's $12 chicken sandwich (which was a piece of chicken on bread with cheese- nothing else) was anemic.   I don't even want to share what the cost of our meal was. Just know we could have gone to a steakhouse and paid less.  Save your money. Go to a fast food restaurant nearby and get better food for cheaper. There just won't be football on tv.

JlxGfkiyQWVg1UOodvQEGQ.text: I am not a fan of this location. I'd rate the location at Town Square at about a four after many visits, but my visits to this location have amounted to a two star. Maybe I'm in the minority here because their parking lot is jam packed every time I drive by here.   I'm thinking the appeal may be strictly related to alcohol and TV. The food I've had here just hasn't been good, mediocre at best. I wouldn't say the food on the standard menu is expensive, but it's overpriced for the quality.   On one of my visits I came here for Happy Hour with coworkers and the food for that was acceptable, but not great. It was cheap at least.   This spot just isn't my type of place. I'm more of a Yard House gal if I'm going to a sports bar.

V13DyNgnquBezJYUmdKDsw.text: I was happy to see a new restaurant open along Stephanie.  The hubby and I stopped in for lunch to try them out.  We were greeted and seated immediately.  The girls at the front hostess desk were very nice and were very welcoming.   As we were walking to our table, I noticed the amount of tv's mounted along the walls and around the bar area.  This is a great place to watch a game or any huge televised event.  The dining area is huge with tons of seating.  It was very clean and open.  So far so good!  Our waitress, Dee, did an amazing job waiting on us.  Our drinks were always filled and she did it with a smile.  Our food was bought out in a timely manner so no complaints there!  We started off with the Fiesta Nachos.  Wonderful!  They were piled high with cheese, jalapenos, meat, sour cream and guacamole.  I'd get them again.   I went with one of their lunch specials ~ the BLT wrap with fries for $4.99.   Great deal!  I paid the extra .99 for sweet potato fries since I love them.  The wrap had a good balance of bacon, lettuce and tomato.  Sweet potato fries?  Yum.  They are served with a cinnamon butter~ Can't go wrong with that!  I tried a bite of my husbands steak sandwich.  Oh so perfect.  Great food for us all around.  Miller's is a great addition to the restaurants in the area.  We enjoyed our visit and hope to be back soon.

PJxtEd-tkmhbPQ0x18Gq8w.text: My friend and I went back again last night and finally got to try their happy hour food.  First, a word about happy hour appetizers. This designation used to apply to most of the appetizers, but it seems that they may be trying to limit their selection even further. Our server initially indicated that we could only get the potstickers, fried mozzarella, beer batter onion rings, and spinach dip at $5. However, she did later relent after recommending a second appetizer and subsequently trying to run it through the machine for $5 (and it worked).  By the way, she told me not to tell anybody about the discount thing, so shush.  Anyway, both apps came out at the same time. I was wary about the fried mozzarella at first because the "sticks" looked perhaps two shades lighter than golden brown. Nevertheless, they were crunchy and filled with hot, stringy mozzarella. The layer of breading is not too thin or thick, and the marinara was nice and filled with tomato chunks. It's not spectacular, but solid.  The blackened chicken quesadilla, which our server recommended, had ample chunks of chicken and a decent amount of cheese, some shredded lettuce w/ sour cream, and a nice side of rice pilaf with black beans and diced tomatoes. Using a small amount of sour cream was enough to cover up any dryness issues, and I had no complaints about any of the sides, although I wisely avoided eating all of the sour cream. I thought it was interesting that they cut it into five pieces though, and I'm not sure it ended up in very even sharing between the two of us.  I hesitate slightly to bump up the rating based on the food alone, but there is something quite charming about hearing the more obscure singles or non-singles of some fairly mainstream bands that I enjoy. There were songs from Imagine Dragons, The Heavy, CHVRCHES, Capital Cities on this visit, and I'm sure there were other interesting song selections on my first visit. I'm not sure if I'd hear this sort of music at other places, chain or not.

nYz9a93xMSK0cHpqw6lGxg.text: My husband and I just took his grandparents here this past week and we were all very pleased with the specials, food, and great service from Jose. Definitely a place we will bring our out of town guest to!

muIo0gGod1NsJmFqa-1K2A.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. Great atmosphere, great food/drinks, UFC fights, all sports. Way better than other sports bars. A personal favorite of mine is the Chicken Philly sandwich.

SFYM5_J81KJsdMwHXGSGWg.text: Adding another star to my review.  While the service was not fantastic, it was a definite improvement over previous visits.  Our server failed to write anything down and wound up coming back a few times to ask questions, but the important thing is that everything came out correctly and fresh tasting.    The zingers were good as usual, served with crispy celery and ranch.  The cheesesteak was okay.  A little bland and the meat was crispy (read:odd) but it was not the worse I've had.  I don't think the onion rings were worth the up charge.  I have definitely had better.

qbtUmwjY_ufMH9PZZVjkJQ.text: Most of the time it's very good.  Today just meh.  Disappointing stale chips.  Classic margarita is a let down.  Burgers we also a let down.  All things we've ordered before (cept the margarita, never had one in a tall glass with a straw, an orange and no salt).  The only thing on point was the service.

LyuE6Fp3Ki1PZccSdTXjvQ.text: Full rack of fantastic lean ribs. Only $12.99 impossible to pass up as the Monday 1/2 rack is $10.95. Sweet potato fries are worth the extra 75 cents.

Stcusj0uU8S7Ug17c2A3Fw.text: We've been here twice, with my wife also coming here many times for lunch. She likes coming here for the food. I like the above average beer selection with the many televisions to watch your favorite sporting event. There are plenty of beer and drink specials. The restaurant is spacious and clean and we've had no issues with service on our visits.  On our last visit, my wife and I came here on a Monday night because she saw the baby back rib special for $10.99. My wife was pleased with her ribs and I ordered the Bahamian Mahi Mahi. There are plenty of delicious veggies with this dish, but they overcooked the fish and as you know, mahi mahi turns tough and rubbery. It was edible, but not how I prefer.   We've also been here for the Thursday night prime rib special for $12.99. The night I came for the prime rib, they were out by around 8:00 which is understandable, but they kindly substituted a ribeye for the prime rib.   I would come back here to grab a beer, watch the game, and snack on some bar food.

Uc_b3Le_0yX0KyQ8jG3KMA.text: I will be honest we have been here several times and it's ok. The waitress was just a little pushy in getting us to order after just walking in . UFC was on and the place was packed and we had a party of 6 and felt that the service could have been just a tad bit better .   We all ordered salads and they were good and great deal on pitchers of Miller !! Will go back because of proximity!!

CwErnPDRqWJEotPdUTOObQ.text: I came here for an end of the year party for work. It was for a large group of people, maybe around 50 so we had the back bar area all to ourselves. The food was ordered ahead of time, so there was a spread of hot plates for us to sample. We had an assortment of appetizers like chips and dip, chicken fingers, and sliders.  While I was there I noticed that there was an advertisement of free UFC fights-- that's pretty awesome! I might come back here to watch a fight and grab a few beers. Oh did I mention that their domestic on tap was like $2? WIN!  Miller's might not be the place to have an intimate dinner, however if you are in the mood for beer and apps this might be your place!

YdYU9sCTqfbC54RWuJZVSA.text: Despite this place being the best in town when it comes to great price on drinks, and the servers are AMAZING, especially Timmi, she is awesome and knowledgeable. Now, when it.comes to management, they suck big time, especially the General Manager, no friendliness, not courtesy, no common customer service skills.  We come here all the time and always brinf new people. Example, once we ordered lg order of wings, they came raw and without carrots on the side, we asked the GM for carrots and he just replied "I am out of carrots" that is it. So if you like exceptional service come.see Timmi, and don't deal with management.

5kY8rUuz5wJNJTGsCHZEnw.text: Wow . . . what has happened to the food Miller's . . .it used to be pretty good.  This time we had the lunch special and it was HORRIBLE.  Dried up like it had been reheated . . .the roll tasted worse than day old.  Another person had the soup and the portion was small and it was just ok.  Finally, my wife had the special "seafood" salad and it was also pretty bad.  It used to be that the food was pretty good here . . but the last few times it was not so good.  It seems that the menu has been simplified too.  I guess we should have known something was up as the parking lot used to be full at lunch time and it is no longer the case.  The reason for the 3 starts is that the drink specials and beer selection are super.  So I would definitely come back . . .but I wouldn't order any of the food and instead "drink" my lunch or dinner.

nAVUTfet-DdA35pL01atEg.text: First asked the hostess if we need to check with her to sit in the patio area, she says, "it depends" and she didn't take command of the area, meaning greeting and seating, so we just walked back there ourselves. I asked the bartender if we could sit anywhere and it also was a kinda yes and no. I asked about drink specials until we could get decide on a seat, she grabbed the menu and told me I could get captain Morgan vodka double for $5. I said they make a vodka now? She said yes I can mix it with coke or whatever. Which is hilarious when you read on I'll tell you about the Pepsi.  So we grab a waitress, the slowest droopy drearest one we could find, well the only one. The other girl was running around cause she kept forgetting everything we later discovered from over hearing the table next to us. Anyway we pop a squat on a high top till we beg Jackie 2 times to bus that table so we can sit in chairs not stools. She offers drinks until then, very good. A bucket of beer with 10 ice cubes and a captain Morgan vodka and soda. LOL Sat at the end of the bar waiting to be delivered for a bit, a couple all in black guys strolled along, didn't grab them to deliver nor was anyone cleaning the table. She said she would get it. She decided to take a order from a 4 top in the mean while. I guess a big party just left, but I only seen 2 dirty tables and 6 busy ones. NO one was at the string of high tops. Then she wanted to take are order, I said I'm still waiting for that table. Tell your boss you need help, NO I'll just do it. She replied. She moved like all she had to eat was valium that day. And the brain activity was just as slow.  To the food, the Miller's seafood bake? Awful boiled in water with some seasoning powered here and there. Brought in a net bag. Dry as a fart. Corn mushy and clams cold, awful I'm sure the air condition that was on blasting ceiling fans and the Windows open at 91 degrees out didn't help. I actually opened a wet nap and in less then 3 minutes (yes I did I it twice) it was a piece a loose leaf paper. The waitress had no interest in hearing what I was saying. I DID 3 times attempt to get our unhappiness across.  I asked for a COLD glass with salt and lime for my now warm beer. Knew that was going to happen when the bucket only had 10 cubes. She says "we have Pepsi" again I said, same response. We looked at each other and my date said "NO, an empty glass, cold with.." She interrupted with "oh duh, ok". And the bartender things you serve coke? Huh? Maybe they do have both, im not sure.  The foil baked mahi was SO SO a bit dry and NO flavor. Then the fire place came on, Wtf? It's mid June in Vegas!! The table next to us even was shocked. Wth is going on. First open the huge ass Windows to None and void the air condition, then a fire?  We were SO over this dinner we grabbed our last beers and went out side. Just to noticed the same two glasses on the table outside next to the couch, that we noticed ON THE WAY IN!! We were soooooooo over this evening I would have strangled a manager if I would of demanded to talk to one.  Low and behold, the fire pits kick on outside. We ran for the car!!! Worst $66 plus tip, I don't know why I did that. Ever!!!  I hope to go back in a few months with a totally different out come. All the experienced people out of work, and this is what they come up with. Shame on you! OH and they didn't have the dessert he wanted either. Poor guy we stopped at McDonald's on the way home from dinner, sad.. I have been to the town square location 4 times, NEVER a problem.

hX1SYRuQO5eY86Znx3qMnw.text: I want to give this place 2.5 stars - 3 is just too many. The service was ok, the server was new, which was fine, I just wish she knew the menu better. I really wanted to get the zingers (which they are known for...) but for some stupid reason I ordered the regular burger - it was tasteless, the onion rings were pretty good though. MQ0N1D9h6RZX_Th0I4QC-A.text: This building was my dry cleaning place. I knew something was coming but didn't know what. Happy to see it's a new restaurant for the Henderson area. I did notice the other one in Town Square. Was curious but never went.   First off the parking lot was packed. So automatically I assumed it must be good. I loved they have few special parking spots for hybrid cars. Thought that was cool. My first impression was WOW it's huge. It had to large seating areas. Loved that they give good space between tables so you don't feel like your sharing convo with the table next to you. I came during happy hr. Service was quick. Food came with good timing. Server didn't know menu well bit she was very attentive. I tried happy hr items. Which was calamari. Very good to me cause they give you all bodies no tentacles. It comes with Asian chili sauce which I got on side and asked for marina sauce. Seemed like it went better because they sprinkled  Parmesan cheese on it. The cheeseburger flat bread was awesome. Didn't taste like card board at all. Taste just like a cheeseburger. Loved that you could pick it up and bread wouldn't bend. I thought it was gona be greasy. I would eat again! The spinach dip was good. Not to runny or overwhelming with cheese to where you don't taste the spinach ...got all of those at happy hr. $5 each.. Great deal! Also loved all the t.v. Since my boyfriend is a sports fanatic ...
