S0WEeq3m9XfLhYZxImb1tw.text: We went on a lazy sunday afternoon.  Our server was extremely pleasant,  and the spinach dip was delicious.  The main entrees were meh. They definitely did not look like the photos, and the taste was equivalent to how they looked.  We did get the Capt Jack dessert.  Mmmmmm delicious!

B9a4P6csf8aikZKX0LhXMA.text: I agree there are definitely some glitches to work out here. First of all the parking is a little awkward because there isn't a lot of it out front and it instead encircles the whole building. This mean a long walk if they are busy to get to the front door which was the only door available to enter. So if you have anyone in your party who might have a little trouble walking or negotiating steps you should drop them off at the front door. The other issue is the front lobby feels crowded and tight. If there are quite a few people waiting and you don't want to bake outside in the heat or sit in the vestibule you pretty much feel in the way.  We were seated in a booth after a 10 minute wait and within my party we ordered the twin lobster tails, the half rack of ribs, and the mahi mahi piccata. I ordered the side salad to be brought before the dinner and requested mashed potatoes instead of spinach since the menu indicated that the fish came with a vegetable of the day.  Twin lobster tails were very good according to my husband and better than Red Lobster. They were also more reasonably priced than Red Lobster.  Half rack of ribs were just ok. My father reported that he had had better and worse.  My experience, the salad did not come and when I asked about it the waitress apologized and said that she thought I had asked for it to come with dinner. I cancelled it because dinner would be out at this point any second (which it literally was, it was delivered as she turned around). My fish was on a plate of it's own with no vegetable of the day and I received a plate of mashed potatoes with beef gravy on the side. I sent back the potatoes because it felt like an odd pairing and after taking a bite of the fish sent that back right away also due to it being very bland. If this is their signature sauce they definitely need to work on it.  The manager did come out and offered to have anything else I might want made as fast as possible. She was very kind and even offered to bring me out the salad I had cancelled to take my time and think about it. I elected to get an appetizer since my party at this point was mid way through their meal and got the cheeseburger flat bread. The salad was quite large for a dinner salad and fresh, the cheeseburger flat bread was actually quite good.  We had another minor kerfuffle when the bill was presented and they still had charged us for the fish and potatoes (which I might add I had ordered as a substitution, not a side). The waitress pointed out that they had comped the flat bread and the salad. I found this to be a little offensive since it felt as if she was alluding that I was trying to get out of paying. I told her I had no problem paying for the food I ate but didn't want to pay for the (more expensive) food I did not eat. She apologized and corrected it.  So overall, issues like the parking and lobby probably can't be fixed. Service will hopefully get better as the restaurant grows into itself. Management was quick to respond to a problem in a satisfactory manner. Food was good to ok and an alright value for the money.

d4rUjpzlWitzXe6CVzPdzw.text: Love coming here for Happy hour and dinner specials.  I am gluten intolerant and they always are very accommodating to my requests.  We can also come here with big groups and still get great service.

aWT4g9rs6Vfi9NVTeL44jQ.text: The food is really good here . The food we ordered was the baby back ribs , fish and chips , and some appetizers . Good was delicious and had a good potion size .   Was greeted right away and didn't have to wait for a seat . So far so good . We get seated get our drinks ordered . They come out . Then our food :) but when needed refills our waitress was no where to be found maybe 10 mins . Then came back to say that the drinks we ordered were being refilled in the machine so instead of offering another drink we waited there patiently as food was getting cold . Then finally our drinks had came out .   When it was time to get boxes and a check forget about it . Since she was always gone for awhile I knew it was going to take awhile to get . After asking for boxes and was waiting for more than 5mins for them thankfully a manager was walking around and got boxes in a hurry . She still hasn't attempted to come back with boxes . She finally returns after seeing our food was boxed and table cleared of our plates . Then comes with the check finally !  They need training in customer service ! Hopefully next time will be better !

3uHEPqZpRcbRcKoq8dH9OA.text: So this place is kind of like an Applebees inside but maybe more TV screens so if you want to catch a game it's good for that. Very large and even on a busy Friday night we were able to get right in.  Unlike Applebees their ingredients were pretty fresh and well prepared. Husband had a small steak. It was cooked well, very tender. I had the steak salad. It was good that the vegetables were not overly coated with dressing. Just a ligjt vinegrette/ The steak was a cheap cut which isn't unusual for a salad. The fried onions on top were great.  Service was nice, very fast. A good place to pop in for a quick bite or a beer. I'd give it a 3.5 for this type of restaurant.

yKSkzRVv_SCcIz79M85QWA.text: Giving this 5 stars because the service was good and it is a cool place to hang out. Our food was good we got wings a salad and the lunch special poboy. After having poboys in New Orleans nothing can compare so I was a little disappointed by that but overall a great experience and I would return.

s-rHb0mSsjvnp-PzALylrg.text: Love this place, since this restaurant opened up it has been a hot spot in the Henderson area. They've got great food, good service, and lots of Tvs. I would recommend this place to anyone even family's.

e4JWUmN2vEryqeMN9rVKMg.text: My first one-star review in years. I've never felt so compelled to give a restaurant a one-star review as I do right now. Last time I came to this restaurant with my family my wife got food poison. I should've done a one-star review then, but I figured I would wait a while and give this place another chance. Well, that backfired!   Visited Miller's Ale House with my family tonight and had the worst experience ever. Our waiter was the worst. Rushed us through the entire experience and messed up our order in more ways than one. Every plate came out sporadically. First a bake potato and then my zinger sandwich. A few minutes later my daughter's hot dog came out. Then about 5 minutes went by and my mother in law got her grilled zingers with NO sauce. Then 15 minutes went by and my wife got her Prime Rib dinner. By the time the her dinner came out all of our food was cold.  In addition to his sporadic food delivery style, two of our orders were wrong. My son got a quesadilla instead of a grill cheese, so we had to send that back. And I got cheese in my zinger sandwich after I told him several times "no cheese".   After such a frustrating experience we decided to speak to the night manager who was completely incompetent. This guy listened to our complaint and had absolutely NOTHING smart to say. Just stood there with a dumb look on his face. When he finally got the sense to say something decent he said, "what do you want me to do?" repeatedly till my wife lost it and told him to just bring us a to go box and the bill.  He walked away and NEVER came back. Hid in the kitchen till we left. The useless waiter never acknowledged that anything happened and treated us like everything was fine. Even the people around us approached us and said how shocked they were at his inability to handle a very simple situation. I would love to think that this was just a bad night, but last time my wife got food poison this same manager was there and he did nothing for us. At all. This guy should find another profession.  Bottom line, I would NEVER visit MIller's Ale House in Henderson again. I've been to the one at Town Square and never had a bad experience. My advice to Corporate or who ever owns this franchise is to quickly step in and either re-train this poor guy or get a new manager. I've seen many restaurants come and go in that same location and this one might be next!

cgvXS8kLPlEHnbbgi6Vy6w.text: Hostess was very welcoming per arriving and sat us where we requested. Waitress on the other hand I have to say that hands down worse service I have received. Not only did she not place my order in correctly! Which caused me to wait a additional 10 minutes to receive it. She never brought my friends drink to the table. I actually got up and picked it up from the bar since it was just sitting there. In addition to that my friend requested salsa and we timed it. It took 8 minutes to receive that. She was just standing around chatting with her coworkers. Keep in mind the place had maybe 5-7 tables full (2-3 people per table). They had plenty of staff to assist with anything since they were able to hold conversations with each other! I previously posted a review that was positive due to a employee that no longer is there which is unfortunate. Extremely disappointed!

Hwgii_-FtXWTojmmz4UNXQ.text: My family and I were patrons of a Millers Ale House in Jacksonville which we loved. We have tried the one in Henderson twice both times experiencing terrible service. All staff moved at a glacial pace. We were going to a movie and left ourselves an hour and a half. The waiter realized after forty minutes he didn't put our food in. Our drinks came out slow. When our food did come out half of it was cold. When we addressed it to the manager he seemed to not care and did nothing to rectify the situation. No wonder it was half full on a Saturday night. Too bad the other miller ale house at town square is great I recommend going to that one if you are wanting to go to one.

hlxFeX9s1X1yxTJPgg0ycQ.text: I have to say the 5 stars is for the service we recieved. We had a group of 4 tables about over 35 people. yFCkvOA1G2UdZy_Ff9J6Tw.text: I just cannot give Miller's enough stars! My finance and I go there every Monday, sometimes midweek also.The food is EXCELLENT.
